title:
Add a new organization to ROR: 
 
Centro de Investigación Biomédica en Red de Enfermedades Respiratorias
body:
Summary of request: Add a new organization to ROR

Name of organization: Centro de Investigación Biomédica en Red de Enfermedades Respiratorias
Website: https://ciberes.org
Link to publications: https://doi.org/10.3389/fmicb.2021.660403 ; https://doi.org/10.1038/s41467-021-24383-3 ; 10.1080/21505594.2021.1937883 ; https://doi.org/10.1128/JVI.00321-21 ; 
Organization type: Government (An organization that is part of or operated by a national or regional government and that conducts or supports research)
Wikipedia page: 
Wikidata ID: 
ISNI ID: https://isni.org/isni/0000000478633182
GRID ID: 
Crossref Funder ID: 
Other names for the organization: CIBER de Enfermedades Respiratorias; Biomedical Research Networking Center on Respiratory Diseases
Acronym/abbreviation: CIBERES
Related organizations: Related institutions: https://ror.org/00zca7903 ; https://ror.org/01ygm5w19 ;  https://ror.org/03cn6tr16 ; https://ror.org/00dwgct76 ; https://ror.org/009byq155 ; https://ror.org/01gm5f004 ; https://ror.org/050q0kv47 ; https://ror.org/02s65tk16
City: Madrid
Country: Spain
Year established: 
How will a ROR ID for this organization be used? To identify affiliations for research publications, To identify affiliations for datasets
Other information about this request:
comments:
nlundvick
08/28/2021, 18:06:53 | 08/28/2021, 18:06:53
comment_text: In scope, multiple instances of affiliation use. Sibling organizations already in ROR. Recommend adding to ROR.

---
arthurpsmith
09/07/2021, 12:17:49 | 09/07/2021, 12:18:05
comment_text: I added the ISNI for this research institute; they have a slightly different English version of the name - "Biomedical Research Network Centre in Respiratory Diseases", maybe that should be another alias?

Also note that the type for the sibling organizations is listed as "Facility"; that may be more appropriate than "government" here, I think we generally use "Facility" for research institutes like this one.

And yes, this should definitely be in ROR.

---
mariagould
09/30/2021, 12:57:59 | 09/30/2021, 12:57:59
comment_text: https://ror.org/0119pby33 

---

labels: level 2; update record; kitten; org-requested; grid
title: Modify Helmholtz-Zentrum Geesthacht Centre for Materials and Coastal Research (https://ror.org/03qjp1d79)
body:
Summary: Modify an existing organization in ROR
Name of organization: Helmholtz-Zentrum Geesthacht Centre for Materials and Coastal Research
ROR ID: https://ror.org/03qjp1d79

Description of change: 
Dear ROR,
'Helmholtz-Zentrum Geesthacht Centre for Materials and Coastal Research' changed name on March 31, 2021.

We are now: Helmholtz-Zentrum Hereon
Acronym is: Hereon
Website: https://www.hereon.de/
I already sent a correction to Grid today. ISNI and Ringgold have already been corrected.
comments:
nlundvick
05/24/2021, 14:51:33 | 05/24/2021, 14:51:33
comment_text: Per organization website (https://www.hereon.de/innovation_transfer/communication_media/news/100319/index.php.en): "Today the Helmholtz-Zentrum Geesthacht – Centre for Materials and Coastal Research GmbH has been renamed the Helmholtz-Zentrum hereon GmbH." Organization name in ROR should be updated. Not sure if primary name should be updated to "Helmholtz-Zentrum hereon GmbH" or "Helmholtz-Zentrum hereon" (sans "GmbH"). News release includes the GmbH but other data sources such as organization's main webpage, Wikipedia, ISNI do not include the GmbH. Moving to Needs discussion.

The website link at ROR still resolves, but has also been updated and should be changed to "https://www.hereon.de/index.php.en"

---
arthurpsmith
05/24/2021, 18:49:48 | 05/24/2021, 18:49:48
comment_text: I think we would generally leave out the GmbH in the main name, but the new full name with that included should be added as an alias. If you search ror.org right now for 'GmbH' you'll find many matches but only a small fraction include the 'GmbH' in the main display name. We maybe should have a policy on this, but generally I think "co.", "ltd.", "AB" etc. legal-entity-type suffixes should probably go in aliases as a general rule, not in the main name we display unless the organization always includes that part of their official name. 

---
mariagould
05/25/2021, 15:37:34 | 05/25/2021, 15:37:34
comment_text: Decision: Leave GmbH out of main name, and include in the alias

---

06/08/2021, 14:49:06 | 06/08/2021, 14:49:06
comment_text: This looks good to me too! I'm wondering about the location. I went to check if they had a Ringgold ID, and I found 7 locations in South Africa with different Ringgold IDs/ISNIs:

![Screen Shot 2021-06-08 at 7 45 53 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17298577/121206729-9000ff00-c82d-11eb-9b7f-69e3c89d66ee.png)

```
Ringgold ID | Organization Name | Region | Country | Admin Level | City | ISNI
-- | -- | -- | -- | -- | -- | --
202501 |   | Lancet Laboratories | Sub Saharan Africa | South Africa | Gauteng | Richmond | 0000 0004 0500 3622
518386 |   | Lancet Laboratories Rustenburg | Sub Saharan Africa | South Africa | North West | Rustenburg | 0000 0004 6474 2943
518442 |   | Lancet Laboratories Bloemfontein | Sub Saharan Africa | South Africa | Free State | Bloemfontein | 0000 0004 6474 5538
517999 |   | Lancet Laboratories Cape Town | Sub Saharan Africa | South Africa | Western Cape | Cape Town | 0000 0004 6473 1742
518443 |   | Lancet Laboratories Polokwane | Sub Saharan Africa | South Africa | Limpopo | Polokwane | 0000 0004 6474 5546
447407 |   | Lancet Laboratories Pretoria Main Office Pencardia | Sub Saharan Africa | South Africa | Gauteng | Arcadia | 0000 0004 5376 2834
447405 |   | Lancet Laboratories Kwa-Zulu Natal Main Office Durban Central | Sub Saharan Africa | South Africa | KwaZulu-Natal | Durban | 0000 0004 5376 2818
```

Should we list all 7 Ringgold IDs/ISNIs under the same record? The ISNI provided is for the Richmond location, not Johannesburg--and it doesn't look like there is one for Johannesberg.

title: Modify University of the French West Indies and Guiana (https://ror.org/02ryfmr77)
body:
Summary of request: Modify the information in an existing ROR record

Name of organization: University of the French West Indies and Guiana
ROR ID: https://ror.org/02ryfmr77
Which part of the record needs to be changed?
Description of change: University of the French West Indies and Guiana no longer exists since 2015. Following a split, two universities were created:

- University of the French West Indies
- University of Guiana
comments:
mariagould
06/04/2021, 00:16:52 | 06/04/2021, 00:16:52
comment_text: Verified at Wikipedia: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University_of_the_French_Antilles

> It [University of the French West Indies and Guiana] was previously part of a larger institution in combination with campuses in French Guiana known as the University of the French West Indies and Guiana. As a result of funding disputes, that university was separated into two distinct institutions based on its constituent parts in French Guiana and the Lesser Antilles respectively. The separation process was completed by 1 January 2015.

There is already en entry in ROR for University of French Guiana: https://ror.org/00nb39k71. Therefore, to make the registry current, we should rename the existing record for University of the French West Indies and Guiana. 

According to Wikipedia and the university website, I believe the name should be: University of the French Antilles (fr: Université des Antilles).

---
arthurpsmith
06/15/2021, 19:51:35 | 06/15/2021, 19:51:35
comment_text: I agree with Maria on what the new name should be (what is missing from ROR right now). As this is a split it seems like we should somehow deprecate this record and create a new one with the new name? But maybe just changing the name as proposed here is ok.

comments:
adambuttrick
03/16/2022, 16:01:09 | 03/16/2022, 16:01:09
comment_text: Changes (aside from link), appear to have already been applied to the record, I'm guessing as part of a GRID update. @mariagould could you reassess whether this update is still needed?

---
mariagould
03/16/2022, 23:37:08 | 03/16/2022, 23:37:08
comment_text: This is a successor organization to the Finnish Food Safety Authority Evira, which was associated with grid.425556.5 and https://ror.org/01zmp8b44. 

GRID created a new record for the successor org, Finnish Food Authority, which corresponds to https://ror.org/00dpnza76 and https://grid.ac/institutes/grid.509946.7. 

The change to the website that was originally requested was to update the URL to [www.foodauthority.fi](http://www.foodauthority.fi/). This redirects to https://www.ruokavirasto.fi/, which is the URL we have in our metadata.

Therefore, the metadata that we currently have for the Finnish Food Authority (https://ror.org/00dpnza76) appears to be correct so this issue can be closed. I will update the ID in the issue title for clarity. When we do a comprehensive review of ROR IDs that need to be redirected as per merging performed by GRID, the prior ID https://ror.org/01zmp8b44 will be redirected.

title: Add record: T'Sou-ke First Nation
body:
Summary: Add a new organization to ROR

Name of organization to be added | T'Sou-ke First Nation

Organization website | https://www.tsoukenation.com/

Wikipedia | https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/T%27Sou-ke_Nation

Briefly explain why you are requesting a ROR ID for this organization and how the ROR ID will be used. | T'Sou-ke Nation is working with Ocean Networks Canada (ONC) on water quality testing. As a result, we will be collecting data that we would like T'Sou-ke Nation to always receive proper attribution and credit for. We would also like to use ROR ID for any future data that T'Sou-ke collects.

Provide DOI(s) or links for research associated with this organization, such as published articles that include the organization's name as an affiliation. If DOIs or links are not available, describe the research-related activities of this organization. | At this time the main data being collected is for water quality testing in the Sooke basin to collect evidence of pollution. We will use this data to come up with a plan to bring the water to acceptable levels so that we can fish our clam beds once again.

Other relevant metadata about the organization (e.g., name variants in other languages, related records in ROR, links to external records such as Wikidata) | http://www.tsoukenation.com/, Sooke, tsouke, t'souke, tsou-ke
comments:
mariagould
04/28/2021, 19:58:28 | 04/28/2021, 20:00:24
comment_text: I think this should be added to ROR because they are conducting research and are considered an independent organization (First Nation government).

title: Add a new organization to ROR: Digital Research Alliance of Canada
body:
Summary of request: Add a new organization to ROR

Name of organization: Digital Research Infrastructure Organization
Website: https://engagedri.ca/
Link to publications: https://engagedri.ca/canadian-digital-research-infrastructure-needs-assessment/white-paper-submissions
Wikipedia page: 
Wikidata ID: 
ISNI ID: 
GRID ID: 
Crossref Funder ID: 
Ringgold ID: 
Other names for the organization: Nouvelle organisation d’infrastructure de recherche numérique
Acronym/abbreviation: NDRIO, NOIRN
Related organizations: 
City: Ottawa
Country: Canada
Other information about this request: Since NDRIO is a new organization, there is not much published research by NDRIO-affiliated staff yet; I included a link to the white papers submitted to NDRIO as part of an open call.
comments:
arthurpsmith
04/30/2021, 13:58:10 | 04/30/2021, 13:58:10
comment_text: This looks like it is primarily going to be a research funding organization, but they haven't started funding research yet (starting in early 2021). They don't even have a Crossref Funder ID yet (not to mention any of the other ID's we look at). I think we ought to put this on hold for a few months or maybe a year to be sure they actual become operational. I don't see that they need a ROR id right now anyway.

---
KellyStathis
04/30/2021, 17:20:05 | 04/30/2021, 17:20:05
comment_text: I work for NDRIO now and can speak to our context—we are definitely operational! NDRIO is already funding research activities (https://portagenetwork.ca/news/call-for-applications-ndrio-portage-covid-19-data-curation-funding/), with another funding opportunity imminent: https://engagedri.ca/pre-announcement-of-inaugural-funding-opportunity

NDRIO absorbed staff from the Canadian Association of Research Libraries' (https://ror.org/001tw8739) Portage Network (https://portagenetwork.ca/) on April 1, and will soon absorb staff from Compute Canada (https://ror.org/03ty8yr27). Our thinking is that since these organizations have ROR ids, we shouldn't lose that due to the merger.

In addition to NDRIO providing funding, NDRIO staff (including the Portage Network team, focused on research data management) produce research; the organization facilitates research activities, and we educate researchers through training. Here are publications for the Portage Network - https://zenodo.org/communities/portage-network/

Some comparable organizations internationally would be the Australian Research Data Commons (https://ror.org/038sjwq14) and JISC (https://ror.org/01rv9gx86), both of which have ROR ids.

Please let me know if you have further thoughts on this! 

---
arthurpsmith
04/30/2021, 18:05:11 | 04/30/2021, 18:06:56
comment_text: Hi Kelly - great context on this, obviously I didn't realize you were involved! Do you know if NDRIO has contacted Crossref to create a funder id? You mention NDRIO "absorbed staff" from other organizations - do those other organizations still exist, or were they merged into NDRIO? It's not clear from any of the websites what the history is on this. But whether or not they were fully merged, I agree if people were publishing with a CARL/Portage Network etc. affiliation and are now with NDRIO and likely to publish with that affiliation that's a good reason to go ahead now.

Is there a reference document somewhere that explains the history and plans a bit?

---
KellyStathis
04/30/2021, 19:55:44 | 04/30/2021, 19:55:44
comment_text: Hi Arthur - that's a good question, I will follow up on contacting Crossref! One complicating factor is that we anticipate a name change in the coming months (the _New_ Digital Research Infrastructure Organization was meant to be a placeholder). Crossref seems to use multiple DOIs to cover renaming (with the "renamedAs"/"continuationOf" relationship), so it may be easiest to defer? I went ahead with the ROR submission at the request of a colleague, who was submitting a manuscript, had to add her affiliation, and realized we didn't have a ROR yet. :) 

Yes, the Canadian Association of Research Libraries still exists--the Portage (RDM) team has just moved over. We were previously funded by NDRIO and employed by CARL; now we're directly employed by NDRIO. Not sure if adding Compute Canada will be more of a merger, or if they will continue to exist separately in some form.

This page from the Government of Canada is the clearest explanation: https://www.ic.gc.ca/eic/site/136.nsf/eng/home along with this FAQ: https://www.ic.gc.ca/eic/site/136.nsf/eng/00003.html.

---
arthurpsmith
05/01/2021, 13:59:41 | 05/01/2021, 13:59:41
comment_text: Ok, I'm convinced this should be added to ROR soon then, it's definitely a major new Canadian organization, though we should be aware a name change is coming!

---
carlyrobinson
05/05/2021, 12:40:33 | 05/05/2021, 12:40:33
comment_text: I appreciate all of the additional information from Kelly. I heard Mark Leggot's talk about NDRIO at RDA. Based on the ROR documentation and what I heard during the talk, I am supportive of assigning a ROR.

---
mariagould
05/20/2021, 18:53:18 | 05/20/2021, 19:10:02
comment_text: @KellyStathis in the metadata record for NDRIO, should CARL, Compute Canada, and Portage be listed as child organizations? Or related organizations? (Or something else?)

Also - is it located in Ottawa or Toronto? (the website indicates an address in Toronto)

---
KellyStathis
05/21/2021, 15:33:10 | 05/21/2021, 15:33:10
comment_text: @mariagould CARL and Compute Canada should not be listed as child or related organizations.

- CARL is fully separate from NDRIO
- Compute Canada will become part of NDRIO, but isn't yet
- Portage is fully under NDRIO, and would be a child organization if we had a ROR--but I don't think we do

One related organization to add would be ISED, who funds NDRIO: https://ror.org/03zp01h17

Ottawa is the official location.

---
mariagould
05/21/2021, 23:47:52 | 01/22/2022, 01:07:12
comment_text: Thanks for the clarification, Kelly!


---
KellyStathis
10/25/2021, 16:25:37 | 10/25/2021, 16:25:37

title: Add a new organization to ROR: KBASE
body:
Summary of request: Add a new organization to ROR

Name of organization: KBase
Website: https://www.kbase.us/
Link to publications: Platform publication: 10.1038/nbt.4163
Updates to features, databases, data sets: 0.1109/CANOPIE-HPC49598.2019.00009; 10.1038/s41587-020-0718-6; doi.org/10.1093/nar/gkaa746E
Examples of user research: 10.25982/59912.37/1635154; 10.25982/51077.6/1637903; 10.25982/54100.27/1635639
Wikipedia page: 
Wikidata ID: 
ISNI ID: 
GRID ID: 
Crossref Funder ID: 
Ringgold ID: 
Other names for the organization: 
Acronym/abbreviation: 
Related organizations: https://ror.org/01bj3aw27 (parent)
City: 
Country: 
Other information about this request: 
KBase is a free, open source data analysis and sharing platform funded by the Department of Energy to support research and education in systems biology and bioinformatics. KBase supports the movement towards FAIR data principles. For example, data sets and reproducible analysis workflows can received DOIs that can be included in publications.

KBase is a data analysis platform that allows users to combine data from many sources to do sophisticated analysis thru a free, open source, graphical user interface. I believe that unique research discoveries are enabled by our platform, and we are now able to produce static snap-shots of analysis workflows, which get a DOI and can be submitted in a publication, for example in a data availability statement. So, yes - included in publication metadata associated w the DOI for the data workflow. We would include the ROR ID directly into the DOI metadata, which would sync automatically with DataCite.

For several of us on the project that are still active researchers, we would also include the ROR ID in our ORCID accounts, for example. We are hoping, in a few years, to start enabling a post-doc program and possibly community grants to work with us, which could also utilize the affiliation ID.
comments:
mariagould
04/27/2021, 13:13:44 | 04/27/2021, 13:13:44
comment_text: I think this should be added to ROR as it is essentially a data publisher (and is identified as a publisher in DataCite metadata).

---
carlyrobinson
04/27/2021, 17:59:32 | 04/27/2021, 17:59:32
comment_text: I think KBase should be added to ROR. It is a data publisher that is assigning DataCite DOIs. It is within scope and not already in ROR.

---

title:
Modify the information in an existing ROR record: 
University of Bergen (https://ror.org/03zga2b32)
body:
Summary of request: Modify the information in an existing ROR record

Name of organization: University of Bergen
ROR ID: https://ror.org/03zga2b32

Description of change: Remove finish name, add new names and update web reference

Names:
University of Bergen
Universitetet i Bergen
Universitas Bergensis
Bergen University

website: http://www.uib.no/en

I don't know what "Crossref Funder ID 501100005036" should be, but the link doesn't work
Update: delete.aliases==Universitetet i Bergen; add.labels==Universitetet i Bergen*Norwegian; add.labels==Universitas Bergensis*Latin; delete.links==http://www.uib.no/en/node/36362; add.links==http://www.uib.no/;
comments:
mariagould
04/29/2021, 16:23:56 | 04/29/2021, 16:24:31
comment_text: Recommendation:

- Do not remove the existing Finnish name that is already part of the metadata. There is no specific reason given for removing this, and the Finnish name could be helpful in discoverability. 
- Move the existing alias (Norwegian name, Universitetet i Bergen) to a language label field (`no`) so it is tagged appropriately
- Add additional language label field for Latin (`la`) version of name, "Universitas Bergensis"
- Add "Bergen University" as an alias
- Update website to http://www.uib.no
- Ignore comment about Crossref Funder ID. The existing ID in the metadata resolves appropriately to the Funder Registry (https://api.crossref.org/funders/501100005036)

title:
Modify the information in an existing ROR record: 
IK4-AZTERLAN (https://ror.org/009mwwv16)
body:
Summary of request: Modify the information in an existing ROR record

Name of organization: IK4-AZTERLAN
ROR ID: https://ror.org/009mwwv16

Description of change: The commercial name of our organization has changed.Our current name is: AZTERLAN Metallurgy Research Centre

Update: change.name==AZTERLAN; add.aliases==AZTERLAN Metallurgy Research Centre; add.aliases==Fundación AZTERLAN; add.aliases==IK4-Azterlan; add.labels==AZTERLAN Metalurgia Ikerketa Zentroa*Basque; add.labels==AZTERLAN Centro de Investigación Metalúrgica*es;
comments:
mariagould
04/29/2021, 16:05:14 | 04/29/2021, 16:05:14
comment_text: This one is a little confusing. 

- The name in the current ROR record is IK4-AZTERLAN. The requestor (a marketing manager from the organization) is requesting that the name be changed to AZTERLAN Metallurgy Research Centre. 
- "Metallurgy Research Centre" is a subtitle on the organization website but I am not seeing it prominently used elsewhere.
- Based on the first four publications listed on the website (http://www.azterlan.es/en/scientific-publications.html), the requested new name does not appear to be a common affiliation name. The publication examples use "Azterlan" or "Fundación Azterlan."

Based on the above, should we change the primary name to "Azterlan" and then add aliases for "Azterlan Metallurgy Research Centre",  "Fundación Azterlan", and "IK4-Azterlan"?

---
arthurpsmith
04/30/2021, 13:38:59 | 04/30/2021, 13:38:59
comment_text: A few thoughts:
* AZTERLAN is always fully in upper-case (on their website and also in affiliations in publications), I think we  should follow that
* We may also want to add the Basque ('eu' language code) name "AZTERLAN Metalurgia Ikerketa Zentroa" and Spanish ('es') "AZTERLAN Centro de Investigación Metalúrgica".
* There's a Wikidata entry - https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q30267191 and also a LinkedIn company page: https://www.linkedin.com/company/ik4-azterlan/ which states the full name as "AZTERLAN Metallurgy Research Centre"

However, I agree that the "AZTERLAN Metallurgy Research Centre" name has not appeared as an affiliation in publications yet. So I think what you suggest is fine, except we should capitalize AZTERLAN in all instances and add the Spanish and Basque full names. Make sense?

---
mariagould
05/06/2021, 16:04:33 | 05/06/2021, 16:04:33
comment_text: I agree with your recommendations! Thanks.

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:05:14 | 03/17/2022, 22:05:14
comment_text: Record updated in release v1.0.

---

title: Modify National Technical University of Ukraine “Igor Sikorsky Kyiv Polytechnic Institute” (https://ror.org/00syn5v21)
body:
Summary: Modify an existing ROR record

Name of organization: National Technical University of Ukraine “Igor Sikorsky Kyiv Polytechnic Institute”
ROR ID: https://ror.org/00syn5v21

Description of change:
We would like to correct the name of our University since it was modified in 2016: https://kpi.ua/en  

We ask you to correct the name of the University in different languages as follows:

- In English: Igor Sikorsky Kyiv Polytechnic Institute

- In Ukrainian: Національний технічний університет України ""Київський політехнічний інститут імені Ігоря Сікорського""

- In Russian: Национальный технический университет Украины ""Киевский политехнический институт имени Игоря Сикорского""
- In Polish: Igor Sikorsky Kijowski Instytut Politechniczny

In English and Polish we would like to see the short title because we ask our scientists use this variant when publish their works (see, e.g., University's profile in WoS: http://wcs.webofknowledge.com/RA/analyze.do?product=WOS&SID=C4WDvIZh1CX2IioEyKN&field=TASCA_JCRCategories_JCRCategories_en&yearSort=false)

Update: change.name==Igor Sikorsky Kyiv Polytechnic Institute; add.labels==Національний технічний університет України ""Київський політехнічний інститут імені Ігоря Сікорського""*Ukrainian; add.labels==Национальный технический университет Украины ""Киевский политехнический институт имени Игоря Сикорского""*Russian; add.labels==Igor Sikorsky Kijowski Instytut Politechniczny*Polish; add.aliases==NTUU “Igor Sikorsky Kyiv Polytechnic Institute”; add.aliases==Kyiv Polytechnic Institute; add.acronyms==NTUU KPI; add.acronyms==KPI;
comments:
mariagould
04/29/2021, 12:49:38 | 04/29/2021, 12:50:13
comment_text: This request is essentially asking to remove "National Technical University of Ukraine" from the English and Polish versions of the name since the requestor claims that they ask scientists to use the shorter variant ("Igor Sikorsky Kyiv Polytechnic Institute") in publications.

I have verified this usage of name in English on the university website. I have checked Google Scholar but do not see any example articles using the shortened version. (I do not have access to WoS). 

My question is, is it appropriate for ROR to use the shortened version of the English and Polish names? 



---
arthurpsmith
04/29/2021, 15:49:42 | 04/29/2021, 15:49:42
comment_text: The English wikipedia page uses their preferred short name: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Igor_Sikorsky_Kyiv_Polytechnic_Institute
It also uses an even more abbreviated name of just "Kyiv Polytechnic Institute" in the infobox on the right; that was apparently the official name 1992–1995 according to the article there.

There are English affiliations that use an acronym for the first part of the full name - 'NTUU “Igor Sikorsky Kyiv Polytechnic Institute”' (see https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S0304885318329342). However I also didn't find any with  just their preferred version.

Here's what I recommend so people searching for the full name or other versions will find this:
* Replace the primary name entry with their preferred English name
* Add all the various versions of the name as aliases or alternate language versions - that includes both Polish versions, the current primary name,  NTUU “Igor Sikorsky Kyiv Polytechnic Institute”, Kyiv Polytechnic Institute, and any other versions that make sense.
* Also add acronym versions: "NTUU KPI" and "KPI"

---
mariagould
05/06/2021, 16:07:12 | 05/06/2021, 16:07:12
comment_text: I agree with your recommendations! Thanks.

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:05:11 | 03/17/2022, 22:05:11
comment_text: Record updated in release v1.0.

---

title: Add a new organization to ROR: North Carolina Geological Survey
body:
Summary of request: Add a new organization to ROR

Name of organization to be added | North Carolina Geological Survey

Organization website | https://deq.nc.gov/about/divisions/energy-mineral-land-resources/north-carolina-geological-survey

Briefly explain why you are requesting a ROR ID for this organization and how the ROR ID will be used. | The ROR ID will be used to track the NCGS Coastal Plain Office and Core Repository and its holdings.

Provide DOI(s) or links for research associated with this organization, such as published articles that include the organization's name as an affiliation. If DOIs or links are not available, describe the research-related activities of this organization. | Applied research in mapping, stratigraphy, hydrostratigraphy, sedimentology, geomorphology, geologic hazards, Quaternary, bedrock geology.https://deq.nc.gov/about/divisions/energy-mineral-land-resources/north-carolina-geological-survey/ncgs-publications

Other relevant metadata about the organization (e.g., name variants in other languages, related records in ROR, links to external records such as Wikidata) | North Carolina Geological Survey Coastal Plain Office and Core Repository

Related organizations: https://ror.org/01ftg8r37 (parent)
comments:
KellyStathis
04/28/2021, 16:44:42 | 04/28/2021, 16:44:42
comment_text: I think this is in scope for ROR and should be added. ROR already includes other state geological surveys (e.g. Arizona, Utah). Note that the NCGS has a parent organization in ROR (the NC DEQ), however it is also an organization/affiliation on its own.

One question - the submission mentions the "NCGS Coastal Plain Office and Core Repository", which looks like an office within the NCGS: https://deq.nc.gov/about/divisions/energy-mineral-land-resources/north-carolina-geological-survey/contact-us#Geological_Survey. I am not sure if we should include this as an alias/alternate name or not, since it is a subdivision? Either way, I think the NCGS should be added; this is a question for the metadata preparation.

Additional information:
Wikipedia page: n/a
Wikidata ID: n/a 
ISNI ID: n/a
GRID ID: n/a
Crossref Funder ID: n/a
Ringgold ID: unknown
Other names for the organization: NC Geological Survey
Acronym/abbreviation: NCGS
Related organizations: Parent organization - North Carolina Department of Environmental Quality (NC DEQ) - (https://api.ror.org/organizations/https://ror.org/01ftg8r37)
City: Raleigh, North Carolina
Country: United States

---
arthurpsmith
04/29/2021, 13:11:57 | 04/29/2021, 13:11:57
comment_text: Their publications list is self-published stuff, so not really academic journals, though they are data providers so maybe that would be enough anyway. However, I did find some papers where this is used as an affiliation - for example https://progearthplanetsci.springeropen.com/articles/10.1186/s40645-015-0062-5 -  author Kathleen M. Farrell. 

Also I could not find it in any of our standard databases (Wikidata, ISNI, etc.) ISNI does have https://isni.org/isni/0000000090078338 - but that appears to refer to their "Bulletin" and not the organization itself. So this would be new with us.

Anyway, I agree we should add this one.

---
mariagould
05/06/2021, 16:14:20 | 05/06/2021, 16:14:20
comment_text: Agree with above, and to Kelly's question about the name I think we should go with "North Carolina Geological Survey" and leave "NCGS Coastal Plain Office and Core Repository" out of the metadata (at least for now).

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:27:39 | 03/17/2022, 22:27:39
comment_text: Assigned ROR ID https://ror.org/03qhydd02 in release v1.0.

---

Acronym/abbreviation:

Country: 
Other information about this request: "The National Biodiversity Network (NBN) is a collaborative partnership created to exchange biodiversity information.  The NBN Trust is the charity that oversees and facilitates the development of the NBN. We manage the NBN Atlas, which is the UK depository of biodiversity data and the UK GBIF node. 

We would like to encourage our data partners to use ROR identifiers when they share data with the NBN Atlas, and the first step is to have a ROR identifier for the NBN Atlas. We would ask people to use the ROR ID when they cite the NBN Atlas. 

I am not sure whether the ID should be for the NBN Atlas (which is the data portal) or for the NBN Trust (which manages the NBN Atlas)."

arthurpsmith
04/30/2021, 14:22:55 | 04/30/2021, 14:22:55
comment_text: Some metadata on this one:
Wikidata ID: https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q106597238
No ISNI or Crossref Funder ID (or GRID ID) available.
Website: https://ble.lternet.edu/
Publications list: https://ble.lternet.edu/bibliography
Acronym: BLE LTER
City: Utqiaġvik, Alaska
Country: USA

Parent organization: "Long-Term Ecological Research Network"
Wikidata ID: https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q6673290
Wikipedia page: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Long_Term_Ecological_Research_Network
Website: http://www.lternet.edu/
Acronym: LTER
Also has no ROR entry
(also this is part of "International Long Term Ecological Research Network (ILTER)")

In both cases these do not appear to be used as an affiliation, but they are cited as funders (despite not having a Crossref Funder ID) - for example https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fmicb.2021.601901/full states "Funding was provided by ... the Beaufort Lagoon Ecosystems Long Term Ecological Research program (BLE LTER) under NSF award 1656026."

I think both of these should be added to ROR as significant research funders; at the least we should add the parent network.

title: Add a new organization to ROR: Open Citations
body:
Summary of request: Add a new organization to ROR

Name of organization to be added | OpenCitations

Organization website | http://opencitations.net/

Briefly explain why you are requesting a ROR ID for this organization and how the ROR ID will be used. | Scholarly infrastructures such as CDL, Crossref and DataCite all have RORs. Inspired by PIDapalooza 2021, and following these examples, I request a ROR for OpenCitations ("an independent infrastructure organization for open scholarship").
Provide DOI(s) or links for research associated with this organization, such as published articles that include the organization's name as an affiliation. If DOIs or links are not available, describe the research-related activities of this organization. | https://doi.org/10.1162/qss_a_00023

Other relevant metadata about the organization (e.g., name variants in other languages, related records in ROR, links to external records such as Wikidata) | https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OpenCitations, https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q29279836, https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q76434478

Summary of request: Add a new organization to ROR

--

**Curator Recommendation MC**

Name of organization: OpenCitations
Website: http://opencitations.net
Link to publications: Silvio Peroni, David Shotton (2020). OpenCitations, an infrastructure organization for open scholarship. Quantitative Science Studies, 1(1): 428-444. https://doi.org/10.1162/qss_a_00023
Wikipedia page: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OpenCitations
Wikidata ID: https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q29279836
ISNI ID: Not found
GRID ID: Not found
Crossref Funder ID: Not found
Ringgold ID: Not found
Other names for the organization: None
Acronym/abbreviation: OC
Related organizations: None
City: Oxford (see comment below regarding city and country)
Country: United Kingdom
comments:
mconlon17
05/11/2021, 16:12:07 | 05/11/2021, 16:12:07
comment_text: Regarding city and country -- OpenCitations appears to be mostly virtual with collaborators and participants in multiple countries.  Their web site does not appear to list a mailing address.  The founder is located in Oxford, UK.

---
carlyrobinson
05/19/2021, 20:00:14 | 05/19/2021, 20:00:14
comment_text: The organization is participating in research producing data and making it available. I believe there are two people running the organization who also have additional affiliations. The organization does not seem to be used as an affiliation. The organization started as a project in 2010.

---
mariagould
06/08/2021, 14:56:48 | 06/08/2021, 14:57:04
comment_text: This is related to the request in #63. Additional information from the requestor about the relationship between the two entities and the interest in having ROR IDs for both:

> OpenCitations is distinct from and pre-existed the Research Centre, having grown to become a valuable independent infrastructure from a small beginning as a research project in my lab.

> The Research Centre was created specifically for two purposes: (a) to provide an institutional affiliation, a legal financial centre, and a formal administrative 'home' for OpenCitations, and (b) to permit academic activities affiliated with OpenCitations, such as being the academic home for graduate students of the University of Bologna working on projects involving open citations.  The Research Centre is formally a part of the University of Bologna in a way that OpenCitations is not.

> In the medium-term future, OpenCitations may 'spin out' to become a non-profit foundation /association/Stiftung under direct governance by the wider academic community and other stakeholders, that is administratively and financially independent from the University of Bologna.  In that case, OpenCitations will continue with its stated mission of providing open bibliographic metadata and citations, and the Research Centre will continue as an integral part of the University of Bologna in its academic roles with respect to OpenCitations, and will probably by then also have expanded its activities to include other types of metadata-oriented research work, but it will no longer be administratively and financially responsible for OpenCitations.

---
mariagould
06/08/2021, 17:04:42 | 06/08/2021, 17:04:42
comment_text: Determination via group discussion: This should be added to ROR so the ROR ID can be used to identify the initiative's contributions to scholarly infrastructure. This sets a precedent for similar initiatives that could be added to ROR in the future, such as VIVO and FORCE11. 

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:27:35 | 03/17/2022, 22:27:35
comment_text: Assigned ROR ID https://ror.org/00wb4mk85 in release v1.0.

---

comment_text: Clearly a significant research-involved organization; however I have not been able to find any publications using "Microscopy Australia" as an affiliation. There are lots of papers which acknowledge use of its resources, but it doesn't seem to be what (any?) authors consider themselves to belong to. This seems similar to the MagIC case which I thought needed further discussion. However somebody else can also weigh in. Other than the lack of use as an affiliation, I think this would be clearly suitable for adding to ROR.

---
carlyrobinson
06/21/2021, 16:19:18 | 06/21/2021, 16:19:18
comment_text: Interesting case where this is a network on microscope facilities that can be used by Australian researchers. The microscopes seem to be at university that would already have ROR IDs. Since it is being acknowledged in publications, it may make sense to assign a ROR since it fits other criteria - more than one parent organization (network of universities), independent domain, run by more than one person, established/stable. 

---
mariagould
01/20/2022, 15:06:07 | 01/20/2022, 15:06:07
comment_text: Further information from the organization. Note that I have added MicroAU to the acronym in the summary data above.

> Microscopy Australia is a network of microscopy facilities that are hosted at universities. We provide funding for infrastructure and personnel. As a result, researchers acknowledge Microscopy Australia for support in their publications but there is no researcher affiliated with Microscopy Australia per se. In the Australian research environment, Microscopy Australia is the same type of research facility as the Australian National Imaging Facility (NIF, https://ror.org/01kdbsa35) and AuScope (https://ror.org/04s1m4564).
> 
> Acronym/abbreviation: in the application, I wrote “n/a”. In the GitHub board, it is “MA”. If an acronym were to be used, I would prefer “MicroAU” instead of “MA”. Microscopy Australia has recommended that researchers and partners (in Australia and overseas) do not use “MA” when referring to Microscopy Australia. If anything, in Australia, “MA” is “Metabolomics Australia”.

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:27:22 | 03/17/2022, 22:27:22
comment_text: Assigned ROR ID https://ror.org/042mm0k03 in release v1.0.

title: Add a new organization to ROR:  Pacific Centre for Isotopic and Geochemical Research
body:
Summary of request: Add a new organization to ROR


Name of organization to be added | Pacific Centre for Isotopic and Geochemical Research

Organization website | https://pcigr.eos.ubc.ca/

Briefly explain why you are requesting a ROR ID for this organization and how the ROR ID will be used. | I see having a ROR as an excellent means of highlighting all research output including data sets, journal articles, and dissertations. Currently research data sets are scattered across a number of research data repositories including Pangaea, Zenodo, EarthChem/IEDA and Dataverse.

Provide DOI(s) or links for research associated with this organization, such as published articles that include the organization's name as an affiliation. If DOIs or links are not available, describe the research-related activities of this organization. | isotopic geochemistry

Other relevant metadata about the organization (e.g., name variants in other languages, related records in ROR, links to external records such as Wikidata) | pcigr
comments:
arthurpsmith
04/30/2021, 15:33:58 | 04/30/2021, 15:33:58
comment_text: Not listed in any of our standard databases. It appears to be entirely part of one of the departments at the University of British Columbia; website is also under that domain. Papers I have found with this as an affiliation always list it as something like "PCIGR, Department of ..., University of British Columbia". So it does not qualify as an independent top-level organization - University of British Columbia should be used. I think this is a clear no given our guidelines.

---
carlyrobinson
06/07/2021, 13:46:58 | 06/07/2021, 13:46:58
comment_text: I would recommend that the Centre be added to ROR. I understand that the Pacific Centre for Isotopic and Geochemical Research is a user facility where researchers outside of the university can use the lab equipment. The centre has separate branding from the university, there are other similar organizations in ROR, it is established, and run by more than one person. Though the organization may not be used as an author affiliation, it is acknowledged as a facility used during their research - see https://agupubs.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1029/2020GH000264.  

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:27:08 | 03/17/2022, 22:27:08

body:

Website: https://www.dri.ie/

Link to publications: Wellcome Grant id 220151/Z/20/Z (https://wellcome.org/grant-funding/people-and-projects/grants-awarded/digital-preservation-reproductive-health-resources).
Reports from previous research projects: https://doi.org/10.7486/DRI.sx61t2042, https://doi.org/10.7486/DRI.pz50w9969, https://doi.org/10.7486/DRI.qz216736v, https://doi.org/10.7486/DRI.pr76tj28w-1.
Other reports: https://doi.org/10.7486/DRI.qj732p00f, https://doi.org/10.7486/DRI.qb990w327, https://doi.org/10.7486/DRI.5m614676f-1.
Oral History recordings and transcripts from the Atlantic Philanthropies project: https://doi.org/10.7486/DRI.0c48h625z
Academic publications - book chapters, conference papers, journal papers (note: these may not all have the Digital Repository of Ireland as an author affiliation, as the DRI is a consortium including several institutes): https://doi.org/10.4324/9781315575278, https://doi.org/10.1109/IWSG.2015.17, https://www.scopus.com/inward/record.uri?eid=2-s2.0-84959895938&partnerID=40&md5=87f7e82b3da457b51b374dec20dc6bc9, https://doi.org/10.1080/13614576.2015.1114838, https://doi.org/10.1080/13614576.2015.1110398, https://doi.org/10.1108/OIR-01-2015-0031

Wikipedia page: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_Repository_of_Ireland
Wikidata ID: https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q47461569
ISNI ID: 
GRID ID: 
Crossref Funder ID: 
Ringgold ID: 
Other names for the organization: Taisclann Dhigiteach na hÉireann
Acronym/abbreviation: DRI
Related organizations: DRI consortium members: https://ror.org/02tyrky19, https://ror.org/048nfjm95, https://ror.org/019tbdj08
City: Royal Irish Academy, 19 Dawson Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
Country: 

Other information about this request: The Digital Repository of Ireland is a Trustworthy Digital Repository for Ireland's Humanities and Social Science data. In addition to offering long-term preservation of data from Irish researchers we also participate directly in research projects and infrastructures projects including a research component. Current projects include the Wellcome Trust funded "Digital Preservation of Reproductive Health Resources: Archiving the 8th" project and the upcoming CEF-funded EnrichEuropeana+ project due to start in April. We publish in journals and conference proceedings, as well as publishing a range of guidelines on best practice for research data management and other topics relating to Research Data and Digital Preservation.

title: Add a new organization to ROR: Virginia Division of Geology and Mineral Resources
body:
Summary of request: Add a new organization to ROR

Name of organization to be added | Virginia Division of Geology and Mineral Resources

Organization website | https://www.dmme.virginia.gov/dgmr/divisiongeologymineralresources.shtml

Briefly explain why you are requesting a ROR ID for this organization and how the ROR ID will be used. | We are a state geological survey in the USA. We conduct geoscience studies and host a large repository of physical samples of rocks, minerals, and fossils.

Provide DOI(s) or links for research associated with this organization, such as published articles that include the organization's name as an affiliation. If DOIs or links are not available, describe the research-related activities of this organization. | We conduct applied geoscience studies in the Commonwealth of Virginia and publish the results of those studies in maps, reports, and databases. Our focus is on geologic mapping, economic geology, and geologic hazards. Our publications can be searched and downloaded through our website: https://www.dmme.virginia.gov/commerce/

Other relevant metadata about the organization (e.g., name variants in other languages, related records in ROR, links to external records such as Wikidata) | None.

Please add any other information about this request if needed | I am requesting this registration because we have been asked to enter metadata about our physical collections into a database of geological materials repositories. The very first thing they request is our ROR, and we don't have one.
comments:
arthurpsmith
04/30/2021, 15:16:28 | 04/30/2021, 15:16:28
comment_text: We have other state "Geological Survey" organizations, but I'm not sure on this one. No Wikidata or Wikipedia links to be found. Acronym is DGMR.

There is an ISNI for "Geological Survey of Virginia" - https://isni.org/isni/0000000101032918 but that is an old name for this organization which has had several names and department changes. History here: https://www.dmme.virginia.gov/dgmr/history.shtml

They do provide research data and a sample repository; I can't find any regular research publication using this as an affiliation though. There are definitely old publications using the "Virginia Geological Survey" or other names for it as affiliation. So I think it clearly qualifies if we consider its history in full? The parent department (Virginia Department of Mines, Minerals and Energy) also has no ROR but I don't think creating one for that would be preferable in this case, as the DGMR has a longer history than its "parent".

Anyway, leaning towards yes on this, but another opinion would be good!

---
KellyStathis
06/19/2021, 00:13:18 | 06/19/2021, 00:13:18
comment_text: Thanks for sharing this background information! I also found another ISNI for the "Division of Mineral Resources Virginia", which was the name from 1957-2008: https://isni.org/isni/0000000106698815.

I'm leaning in the same direction--that we should consider the history in full, along with the fact that it is a state Geological Survey (and therefore we have other similar organizations in ROR).

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:27:37 | 03/17/2022, 22:27:37
comment_text: Assigned ROR ID https://ror.org/03vtv7935 in release v1.0.

07/13/2021, 14:20:59 | 07/13/2021, 14:23:12
comment_text: The request seems to have some confusion about our display/use of names - IMS is an acronym in our data, even though it's displayed along with the Japanese name. I'm assuming what they really want is to modify the Japanese name, and the requested change there would be to add the string "国立研究開発法人" (Google translates this as "Japanese National Research and Development Agency") at the front, and slightly modify the last part "生命医科学研究センタ" to "生命医科学研究センター" (Google translates both as "Biomedical Science Research Center"). If we just change the name in Japanese along these lines I think that's fine, it does appear to be the more complete official name (see https://www.riken.jp/research/labs/ims/index.html).

labels: level 2; update record; jaguar; split record
title: Modify Netherlands Cancer Institute https://ror.org/03xqtf034
body:
Summary of request: Split an existing ROR record into two or more records

Name of organization: 
Antoni van Leeuwenhoek Hospital NETHERLANDS CANCER INSTITUTE, NKI-AVL, ANTONI VAN LEEUWENHOEKZIEKENHUIS, Nederlands Kanker Instituut

ROR ID: https://ror.org/03xqtf034

Describe what change needs to be made to the ROR record(s). Provide a reason for the change (e.g., the organization no longer exists, or the organization has merged with another one)
We had a reviewer complain that her institution was not in the ROR list. Netherlands Cancer Institute (https://www.nki.nl/ ) is part of the ROR record for Antoni van Leeuwenhoek Hospital, but as you can see, they have distinct websites. Also note that Nederlands Kanker Instituut does not produce the record in question as a top result.

MG Note:
Change name: Netherlands Cancer Institute-Antoni van Leeuwenhoek Hospital
Add label: Nederlands Kanker Instituut (nl)

Update: change.name==Netherlands Cancer Institute-Antoni van Leeuwenhoek Hospital; add.labels==Nederlands Kanker Instituut*nl;
comments:
mariagould
08/20/2021, 16:52:16 | 08/20/2021, 16:52:16
comment_text: This one is a little confusing. From the about section of the websites, it appears as though they are the same organization, even though there are two different websites:

https://www.nki.nl/about-us/organization/
https://www.avl.nl/en/about-the-organization/about-the-nki/#jaarverslagen

My proposal would be to keep it as a single record, determine which URL should be used, and update the name fields so that we have all versions represented for better discoverability and identification. 

---
arthurpsmith
08/23/2021, 20:22:25 | 08/23/2021, 20:22:25
comment_text: Reading the Dutch pages (with Google Translate) it seems clear the Netherlands Cancer Institute is a research institute while Antoni van Leeuwenhoekziekenhuis is a hospital, so they are (somewhat) distinct. They both have wikipedia pages: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antoni_van_Leeuwenhoekziekenhuis and https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Netherlands_Cancer_Institute - and both together make up the "NKI-AVL" which could  have yet another separate organization identifier if we were to split them. Unfortunately there doesn't seem to be a main website for the combined organization. I think it might be best to change the main label here to "Netherlands Cancer Institute-Antoni van Leeuwenhoek Hospital" representing that joint organization. It would be nice if we could link to both websites, but if not I don't think it matters which one we pick. So basically yes I agree with Maria's recommendation here.

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:06:27 | 03/17/2022, 22:06:27
comment_text: Record updated in release v1.0.

title:
Add a new organization to ROR: 
 
Canadian Centre for Electron Microscopy
body:
Summary of request: Add a new organization to ROR

Name of organization: Canadian Centre for Electron Microscopy
Website: https://ccem.mcmaster.ca/
Link to publications: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.gca.2020.11.007, https://doi.org/10.1016/j.chemgeo.2018.07.031
Organization type: Facility (A specialized facility where research takes place, such as a laboratory or telescope or dedicated research area)
Wikipedia page: 
Wikidata ID: 
ISNI ID: 
GRID ID: 
Crossref Funder ID: 
Other names for the organization: none
Acronym/abbreviation: CCEM
Related organizations: McMaster University https://ror.org/02fa3aq29 (related)
City: Hamilton, ON
Country: Canada
Year established: 2004
How will a ROR ID for this organization be used? To identify affiliations for research publications, To acknowledge a research facility
Other information about this request: We are a core research facility located at McMaster University, but have our own affiliation for publications and tracking of publications that come from our facility. We would like a ROR set up for CCEM so we can easily track publications from our Centre and make it easier for our users to cite us in publications.
comments:
arthurpsmith
09/16/2021, 12:17:15 | 09/16/2021, 12:17:15
comment_text: I searched through wikimedia, ISNI and Crossref and they indeed seem not to be listed in any of those. Website is under the university's domain; affiliations of staff in publications also always seem to include the university as well. Searching Google scholar I could not find any cases of acknowledgement of the facility that didn't also include a staff member as one of the co-authors. So I think this does not meet our criteria for an independent top-level research organization.

---
KellyStathis
10/04/2021, 23:23:49 | 10/04/2021, 23:23:49
comment_text: CCEM is one of 17 national research facilities in Canada funded through Major Science Initiatives (MSI): https://web.archive.org/web/20210418061806/https://www.innovation.ca/national-research-facilities

Although these facilities may be hosted at a university, they function more autonomously from the university than a typical department. Other examples in ROR include Ocean Networks Canada (https://ror.org/05gknh003), hosted at the University of Victoria, and Canadian Light Source (https://ror.org/001bvc968), at the University of Saskatchewan. 

Since this facility is considered national, I think it is sufficiently independent from McMaster and meets our criteria for inclusion in ROR. Moving to "Needs discussion".

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:29:07 | 03/17/2022, 22:29:07
comment_text: Assigned ROR ID https://ror.org/02w3v2f07 in release v1.0.

labels: level 2; update record; lion; needs discussion
title: Modify the information in an existing ROR record: Aragón Materials Science Institute (https://ror.org/031n2c920)
body:
Summary of request: Modify the information in an existing ROR record

Name of organization: Aragón Materials Science Institute
ROR ID: https://ror.org/031n2c920
Which part of the record needs to be changed? Primary name, other names, website
Description of change: Now 'Instituto de Nanociencia y Materiales de Aragón' (Spanish)/'Aragon Nanoscience and Materials Institute' (English) - acronym INMA, website https://inma.unizar-csic.es/ - see https://inma.unizar-csic.es/el-instituto/informacion-general/historia/ - this was after a merger with another university institute so maybe this should be a new ID?

MG Note:
Add aliases: Institute of Research in Nanoscience of Aragon; Aragón Materials Science Institute 

Update: add.aliases==Institute of Research in Nanoscience of Aragon; add.aliases==Aragón Materials Science Institute;
comments:
nlundvick
06/07/2021, 18:55:30 | 06/07/2021, 18:55:30
comment_text: Per the history of Institute of Nanoscience and Materials of Aragon (INMA) (https://inma.unizar-csic.es/en/home/history/) this is a new organization created by the merger of the Aragón Materials Science Institute (ICMA) (https://ror.org/031n2c920) with the University Institute of Research in Nanoscience of Aragon (INA). INMA has a website with a different URL from ICMA – https://inma.unizar-csic.es/. INMA is in scope and is used as an affiliation in scientific publications. Recommend creating new ROR for INMA. Because @arthurpsmith posed the question of updating ICMA or creating new ROR for INMA I am moving this to  needs discussion.

---
mariagould
06/08/2021, 15:34:14 | 06/08/2021, 16:59:31
comment_text: Determination: We will create a new ROR ID for INMA since it represents a new entity combining multiple organizations, as opposed to one organization absorbing another. The current record for Aragon Materials Science Institute (https://ror.org/031n2c920) will be redirected to the new record for INMA. The other organization in question, INA, does not have a ROR ID. 

See the new request in #195 

Since ROR does not yet have the functionality for redirecting IDs, this issue will be moved to "Hold for later" until that functionality is ready. 

---
mariagould
06/22/2021, 18:34:53 | 06/22/2021, 18:35:04
comment_text: Update: 
Aragon Materials Science Institute (https://ror.org/031n2c920) maps to GRID ID grid.466773.7. The GRID record has been updated with a new name: Instituto de Nanociencia y Materiales de Aragón. Therefore, we may want to reconsider whether we should create a new record for the Institute of Nanoscience. 

---
mariagould
10/04/2021, 08:24:49 | 10/04/2021, 08:24:49
comment_text: Reviewing this one again with a final recommendation: We have an entry in ROR (https://ror.org/031n2c920) for Instituto de Nanociencia y Materiales de Aragón (INMA), an entity created in 2020 that fused the Institute of Research in Nanoscience of Aragon (INA) (no prior ROR ID) and Aragón Materials Science Institute (ICMA) (the name previously used in https://ror.org/031n2c920). The new institute name is being used as an affiliation in publications, e.g., https://doi.org/10.1016/j.cej.2020.126103.

My recommendation is that we add the prior names Institute of Research in Nanoscience of Aragon and Aragón Materials Science Institute as aliases to the existing record. 

Posting this comment in #195 as well. 

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:04:52 | 03/17/2022, 22:04:52
comment_text: Record updated in release v1.0.

---

comments:
arthurpsmith
09/24/2021, 19:32:33 | 09/24/2021, 19:32:33
comment_text: In the ROR API, 'KANTABRIAKO UNIBERTSITATEA' is listed as a Basque (eu) version of the name, and 'UNIVERSITAT DE CANTÀBRIA' as a Catalan (ca) version. I'm assuming from this message that these are unofficial or unapproved versions of the name. I don't think they add much to discoverability, though they are used on Basque and Catalan websites referring to the university. Anyway, I think it's fine to remove them here. We do have a policy of using the English name (if there is an official one) as the main label in ROR so I think we should leave that. And "UC" is probably not much use as an acronym so fine to remove that also.

So - just remove all the aliases and other-language labels except for Spanish, and leave the rest alone. Make sense?

body:
Summary of request: Modify the information in an existing ROR record

Name of organization: Keldysh Institute of Applied Mathematics
ROR ID: https://ror.org/01dv3hq14
Which part of the record needs to be changed? Other names or name versions listed in the record
Description of change: Please replace the all part of the record "Other names or name versions listed in the record" with the following data in accordance with the Statute of the Institute,  pages 6-7, https://keldysh.ru/doc/ustav.pdf .
Keldysh Institute of Applied Mathematics of Russian Academy of Sciences, KIAM RAS, Федеральное государственное учреждение "Федеральный исследовательский центр Институт прикладной математики им. М.В. Келдыша Российской академии наук", ИПМ им. М.В. Келдыша РАН

MG Note:
Replace label: Федеральное государственное учреждение "Федеральный исследовательский центр Институт прикладной математики им. М.В. Келдыша Российской академии наук" (ru)
Add aliases: ИПМ им. М.В. Келдыша РАН

Update: replace.labels==Федеральное государственное учреждение "Федеральный исследовательский центр Институт прикладной математики им. М.В. Келдыша Российской академии наук"*ru; add.aliases==ИПМ им. М.В. Келдыша РАН;
comments:
arthurpsmith
10/07/2021, 18:28:26 | 10/07/2021, 18:28:26
comment_text: Right now the requested "Keldysh Institute of Applied Mathematics of Russian Academy of Sciences" is included as an alias, so that can be left alone. Also we already have the acronym "KIAM RAS" so leave that as well. I believe we should also leave the shorter English acronym "KIAM" but I guess they're requesting it be removed. I don't think it hurts to leave it.

So I think the changes this is requesting is to remove the current Russian label:
- Институт прикладной математики им. М. В. Келдыша РАН
and replace it with 
- Федеральное государственное учреждение "Федеральный исследовательский центр Институт прикладной математики им. М.В. Келдыша Российской академии наук"

and then also to add another Russian label (or acronym?):

- ИПМ им. М.В. Келдыша РАН

The current Russian label is about half way between those two, so I guess it's fine to remove it and replace with these. Anyway this change seems straightforward and the institute is requesting it so I recommend going ahead.

---

03/17/2022, 22:06:42 | 03/17/2022, 22:06:42
comment_text: Record updated in release v1.0.

Organization type: Company (A private for-profit corporate entity involved in conducting or sponsoring research)

ISNI ID:

Acronym/abbreviation: CORAL
Related organizations: 
City: Karachi
Country: Pakistan
Year established: 2019
How will a ROR ID for this organization be used? To identify affiliations for research publications, To acknowledge research funders, To be integrated in a scholarly publishing system
Other information about this request:
comments:
arthurpsmith
09/07/2021, 12:56:28 | 09/07/2021, 12:56:28
comment_text: The Wikidata ID is no longer valid - it was deleted for lack of supporting information. This is a very small publisher from Pakistan, with 2 journals focused on business management questions. I guess this may count as research publications but it seems out of scope relative to our main focus. Unless we really want to have a complete database of scholarly publishers I don't think this needs to be included in ROR. Willing to listen to a second opinion on this though.

---
KellyStathis
11/01/2021, 19:51:31 | 11/01/2021, 19:51:39
comment_text: I think we need more clarity in our policies to decide this. Do publishers need to be a certain size for inclusion? Generally, I think publishers and journals are better covered by other databases (like Sherpa Romeo). That said, per our our [Guidance for Evaluating Common Organization Types](https://github.com/ror-community/ror-updates/wiki/Curator-Evaluation-Workflow:-New-Records#guidance-for-evaluating-common-organization-types), publishers are generally in scope for ROR: "Add to ROR if: **publishing/hosting research**, and/or if members publish research using this affiliation." Moving to "Needs discussion".

---
arthurpsmith
11/02/2021, 19:45:00 | 11/02/2021, 19:45:00
comment_text: From curation meeting we decided to go ahead with this one.

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:29:01 | 03/17/2022, 22:29:01
comment_text: Assigned ROR ID https://ror.org/03q3ecb97 in release v1.0.

title:
Add a new organization to ROR: 
 
Hakai Institute
body:
Summary of request: Add a new organization to ROR
Name of organization: Hakai Institute
Website: www.hakai.org
Link to publications: https://doi.org/10.21966/1.566666
Organization type: Nonprofit (A non-profit and non-governmental organization involved in conducting or funding research)
Wikipedia page: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hakai_Institute
Wikidata ID: https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q5640294
ISNI ID: https://isni.org/isni/0000000492257240
GRID ID: 
Crossref Funder ID: 
Other names for the organization: N/A
Acronym/abbreviation: Hakai
Related organizations: Tula Foundation https://ror.org/0029jxk29 (parent) funds the Hakai Institute
City: Campbell River, British Columbia
Country: Canada
Year established: 
How will a ROR ID for this organization be used? To identify affiliations for research publications, To identify affiliations for datasets, To acknowledge a research facility
Other information about this request:
comments:
arthurpsmith
12/16/2021, 15:52:36 | 12/16/2021, 15:52:36
comment_text: They definitely have research publications where this is used as an affiliation - the linked publication seems to be a dataset; another example as a regular article is https://doi.org/10.1002/ece3.7022 . The one question I have is the degree of separation between this and the Tula Foundation for which we already have a ROR id (and which is acknowledged as a research funder in itself). Tula seems to be their only source of funds and so is in a sense a top-level organization for Hakai - however when used as an affiliation, Tula doesn't seem to be mentioned, and the website is independent. So I lean towards creating a separate ROR id for Hakai Institute, but I'm not completely certain on this.

---
Br-Johnson
12/16/2021, 19:51:36 | 12/16/2021, 19:51:36
comment_text: The Tula Foundation funds several projects, one of which is The Hakai Institute. Most staff scientists and research technicians would say they work for the Hakai Institute rather than the Tula Foundation. The Hakai Institute is more recognizable as an organization based on the work we publish as opposed to the Tula Foundation. 

Currently, there is no way to affiliate our work with the Hakai Institute in DataCite Metadata Schema for example. We've been using Tula as our affiliation there, but as you'll see most researchers note their affiliation in research papers to the Hakai Institute and then acknowledge the Tula Foundation as the funder.

It is a slightly odd scenario I gather, but I spoke with our President Dr. Eric Peterson on this matter specifically and he is OK with using Hakai as our Research Organization and Tula as the funder as this logically represents how the two organizations are related.

Hope this helps! Happy to provide more context if necessary. 

---
KellyStathis
12/23/2021, 23:08:20 | 12/23/2021, 23:08:20
comment_text: Thanks @Br-Johnson for this added context! I'm familiar with Hakai and this reasoning makes sense to me.

---
KellyStathis
12/23/2021, 23:09:29 | 12/23/2021, 23:09:29
comment_text: Some additional metadata - the Hakai Institute has a Crossref Funder ID: http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/100016884. Note that Crossref references the Tula Foundation as a "broader" organization; I think we should mirror this in ROR, with the Tula Foundation as the parent org.

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:29:55 | 03/17/2022, 22:29:55
comment_text: Assigned ROR ID https://ror.org/02pry0c91 in release v1.0.

Open Data Commons for Spinal Cord Injury
body:
Summary of request: Add a new organization to ROR

Name of organization: Open Data Commons for Spinal Cord Injury
Website: https://odc-sci.org
Link to publications: Some datasets published by the ODC-SCI - DOI:10.34945/F5D01P , DOI:10.34945/F5MG68 , DOI:10.34945/F5R59J , DOI:10.34945/F5NC7X , DOI:10.34945/F5HP4N , DOI:10.34945/F5XW2P , DOI:10.34945/F5S59V , DOI:10.34945/F56C7W , DOI:10.34945/F5B59T ; Some publications referring to the Open Data Commons - DOI:10.1089/neu.2019.6674 , DOI:10.1016/j.expneurol.2017.05.012 , DOI:10.1007/s12021-021-09533-8 , DOI:10.1007/s12021-020-09498-0
Organization type: Other (Use this category for any organization that does not fit the categories above)
Wikipedia page: 
Wikidata ID: 
ISNI ID: 
GRID ID: 
Crossref Funder ID: 
Other names for the organization: N/A
Acronym/abbreviation: ODC-SCI
Related organizations: https://ror.org/0168r3w48 (related), https://ror.org/043mz5j54 (related), https://ror.org/0160cpw27 (related)
City: ODC-SCI is hosted through UCSD (La Jolla, CA)
Country: United States
Year established: 2017
How will a ROR ID for this organization be used? To identify affiliations for datasets, To be integrated in a scholarly publishing system, ROR ID for integration with DataCite
Other information about this request: Description of Repository: The spinal cord injury (SCI) community created the ODC-SCI to mitigate dark data in SCI research. The ODC-SCI also aims to increase transparency with individual-level data, enhance collaboration, facilitate advanced analytics, and conform to increasing mandates by funders and publishers to make data accessible. Members of the ODC-SCI have access to a private digital lab space managed by the PI or multi-PIs for dataset storage and sharing. The PIs can share their labs’ datasets with the registered members of the ODC-SCI community and make their datasets public and citable. The ODC-SCI implements stewardship principles that scientific data be made FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable and Reusable) and has been widely adopted by the international SCI research community.
comments:
KellyStathis
12/23/2021, 22:25:20 | 12/23/2021, 22:25:20
comment_text: This is a data repository for spinal cord injury research. Data repositories are in scope for ROR if they are actively publishing/disseminating research, which is the case for ODC-SCI. It is a collaborative effort between UC San Francisco and the University of Alberta: https://www.ualberta.ca/rehabilitation/news-and-events/news/2019/august/first-global-open-data-commons-for-preclinical-spinal-cord-injury-research-will-be-a-game-changer.html. The submission also indicates it is hosted at UCSD. However, I think it is sufficiently standalone that it is in scope for ROR on its own, with these universities as related organizations.

---

Academician F. H. Burchak Scientific-Research Institute of Private Law and Entrepreneurship
body:

Name of organization: Academician F. H. Burchak Scientific-Research Institute of Private Law and Entrepreneurship
Website: https://ndippp.gov.ua/
Link to publications: https://scholar.google.com.ua/citations?hl=ru&user=fILKwgBRKckC; https://www.scopus.com/affil/profile.uri?afid=60212803
Organization type: Government (An organization that is part of or operated by a national or regional government and that conducts or supports research)
Wikipedia page: https://uk.wikipedia.org/wiki/Науково-дослідний_інститут_приватного_права_і_підприємництва_імені_академіка_Ф._Г._Бурчака
Wikidata ID: Q16708724
ISNI ID: 
GRID ID: 
Crossref Funder ID: 
Other names for the organization: Науково-дослідниq інститут приватного права і підприємництва імені академіка Ф. Г. Бурчака
Labels: Науково-дослідниq інститут приватного права і підприємництва імені академіка Ф. Г. Бурчака (Ukrainian)
Acronym/abbreviation: NDIPPP
Aliases: Academician F. H. Burchak Scientific-Research Institute of Private Law and Entrepreneurship of National Academy of Law Sciences of Ukraine
Related organizations:

Country: Ukraine
Geonames ID: 703448
Year established: 1996
How will a ROR ID for this organization be used? To identify affiliations for research publications, To acknowledge a research facility
Other information about this request:
comments:
adambuttrick
01/27/2022, 18:34:24 | 01/27/2022, 18:47:20
comment_text: State scientific and research institution focused on Ukrainian law, and also part of the National Academy of Legal Sciences of Ukraine. A couple of questions:

-The organization appears to have two parents: the National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine (https://ror.org/00je4t102) and the National Academy of Legal Sciences of Ukraine (not represented in ROR, but should probably be added given https://ror.org/001040111 and https://ror.org/042dnf796). It seems as sufficiently independent, from the affiliation usage, but I think others should weigh in.

https://www.nas.gov.ua/EN/Org/Pages/default.aspx?OrgID=0000661

-For the primary name, there are varying English representations. Should this be what the requestor has provided, or the full form that appears on publications, "The Academician F. H. Burchak Scientific-Research Institute of Private Law and Entrepreneurship of National Academy of Law Sciences of Ukraine"?

Publication affiliation usage: https://iusprivatumjournal.online/en-editorial-board ; https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/35029582/

Google Scholar affiliation usage: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=19EvCn-VR6UC; https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=gI41qtcAAAAJ

ORCID affiliation usage: https://orcid.org/0000-0003-3973-715X ; https://orcid.org/0000-0002-3239-1216 ; https://orcid.org/0000-0001-6578-1491 ;

---
arthurpsmith
01/27/2022, 20:29:56 | 01/27/2022, 20:29:56
comment_text: Hi Adam - other than in the request form, where did you see that this was part of the "National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine" (for which we have a ROR id)? Everywhere I look on this, including in the full affiliation names, it seems to be just part of the "National Academy of Legal Sciences of Ukraine". I agree that should be in ROR, and I think this should be also, given how we handle other institutes of national academies. Also I think we generally don't use those "full form" names as main labels, but it could be an alternate label.

Anyway, other than the relationship to https://ror.org/00je4t102 as a parent organization, I think this is ready to be added here.

---
adambuttrick
01/27/2022, 20:50:24 | 01/27/2022, 20:50:36
comment_text: @arthurpsmith I was extrapolating from the National Academy of Legal Sciences being hosted on the National Academy of Sciences site (https://www.nas.gov.ua/EN/Org/Pages/default.aspx?OrgID=0000661), but now agree that you're correct that the appropriate parent would be the National Academy of Legal Sciences (for which we would need to create a record). Moving to approved and will create an issue for National Academy of Legal Sciences.

---
adambuttrick
01/28/2022, 02:23:17 | 01/28/2022, 02:23:17
comment_text: Created #450 for the parent record.

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:30:42 | 03/17/2022, 22:30:42
comment_text: Assigned ROR ID https://ror.org/02hhf2525 in release v1.0.

title:
Modify the information in an existing ROR record: 
Institute for the Study of Labor https://ror.org/029s44460
body:
Summary of request: Modify the information in an existing ROR record

Name of organization: Institute for the Study of Labor
ROR ID: https://ror.org/029s44460
Which part of the record needs to be changed? Primary name
Description of change: IZA's own website https://www.iza.org gives their English name as 'IZA - Institute of Labor Economics' (or just 'IZA') and their German name as 'Forschungsinstitut zur
Zukunft der Arbeit GmbH (IZA)'

Changes approved by curators:

- Change primary name to "IZA Institute of Labor Economics"
- Add "Institute for the Study of Labor" as an alias.

Update: change.name==IZA - Institute of Labor Economics; add.aliases==Institute for the Study of Labor; replace.labels==Forschungsinstitut zur Zukunft der Arbeit GmbH (IZA)*German;
comments:
arthurpsmith
12/23/2021, 19:37:06 | 12/23/2021, 19:37:06
comment_text: We definitely need to fix the main label here. Looking through Google Scholar, the acronym IZA has been used as part of this affiliation for many years - here's one from 1999: https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=165870
where it is phrased as "IZA Institute of Labor Economics". The request here includes a '-' character, but I don't actually see that anywhere on the iza.org website, it is always (in English) referred to either as IZA, or in the header format with a large IZA followed directly by "Institute of Labor Economics".

As to the German name, the website header in German is the same as in English, with the English version of the name. So that should definitely be our primary label here. We already have the same German name as in this request except without the "GmbH" or parenthetical IZA piece; generally we don't add GmbH's to our German labels, and IZA is there as an acronym so I think we should leave the German version of the name alone.

So the only change I think should be made here is to the primary (English) label which I believe should be:
"IZA Institute of Labor Economics"


---
KellyStathis
01/26/2022, 18:28:30 | 01/26/2022, 18:28:30
comment_text: I agree with Arthur's assessment. My only question is whether we should add "Institute for the Study of Labor" as an alias - I don't see this on their official website, but that comes up as an alternate name for IZA from a few other sources ([Wikidata page](https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q317269), [DDI Alliance](https://ddialliance.org/project/institute-for-the-study-of-labor-iza-international-data-service-center-idsc). I wonder if it is an alternate translation of the German that has stuck?

---
adambuttrick
01/28/2022, 17:02:52 | 01/28/2022, 17:02:52
comment_text: Given the presence of the ""Institute for the Study of Labor" form in two sources, I think we can add this as an alias for discoverability. Moving to approved.

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:07:44 | 03/17/2022, 22:07:44
comment_text: Record updated in release v1.0.

12/23/2021, 23:03:59 | 12/23/2021, 23:03:59
comment_text: This organization is a Brazilian association that "brings together individuals and legal entities interested in developing and improving scientific journals; improve communication and dissemination of information; keep the exchange of ideas, the debate of problems and the defense of the common interests of the community" (https://www.abecbrasil.org.br/novo/estatuto/, translation by Google). ABEC Brasil is also a Crossref member/facilitates Crossref membership: https://www.abecbrasil.org.br/novo/2015/09/estabelecido-o-acordo-abeccrossrefibict-para-facilitar-a-atribuicao-de-dois/

I'm not sure which category this falls under within the [Guidance for evaluating common organization types](https://github.com/ror-community/ror-updates/wiki/Curator-Evaluation-Workflow:-New-Records#guidance-for-evaluating-common-organization-types). 

However, there are similar non-profit organizations in ROR, for example the [Council of Science Editors](https://ror.org/007cr8911), which has [partnered with ABEC Brasil](https://www.councilscienceeditors.org/resource-library/cse-publication-certificate-program/cse-publication-certificate-program-for-abec-members/). Based on this, I think ABEC Brasil is in scope for ROR. They are an established organization and closely related to research activities.
