title:
Modify the information in an existing ROR record: 
German Institute for International and Security Affairs SWP, Stiftung Wissenschaft und Politik  https://ror.org/05frkc804
body:
Summary of request: Modify the information in an existing ROR record

Name of organization: German Institute for International and Security Affairs SWP, Stiftung Wissenschaft und Politik 
ROR ID: https://ror.org/05frkc804
Which part of the record needs to be changed? Primary name, Other names or name versions listed in the record
Description of change: Please change the present record to the following: Stiftung Wissenschaft und Politik (SWP), German Institute for International and Security Affairs (primary name in German); organization website: https://www.swp-berlin.org/

Update: change.name==Stiftung Wissenschaft und Politik, German Institute for International and Security Affairs; replace.labels==Stiftung Wissenschaft und Politik, Deutsches Institut für Internationale Politik und Sicherheit*German;
comments:
MSpenger
12/07/2021, 12:22:20 | 12/07/2021, 12:22:20
comment_text: New name seems to be the corporate wording for the institute and needs to be changed:

`"name":"Stiftung Wissenschaft und Politik (SWP), German Institute for International and Security Affairs"`

Old name could be added as alias:

`"aliases":["German Institute for International and Security Affairs"]`

Link is not working anymore. Suggested change:

`"links":["https://www.swp-berlin.org/"]`



---
arthurpsmith
12/07/2021, 14:52:28 | 12/07/2021, 14:52:28
comment_text: Yes the website link  should be trimmed as suggested.

However, I don't understand quite what is being proposed regarding labels. From their website, the German name of this institute appears now to be:
"Stiftung Wissenschaft und Politik
Deutsches Institut für Internationale Politik und Sicherheit"
(from their Contact page, and also the header on every page)

However the *English* page lists the name they seem to  be requesting, so perhaps this is the official English name?:
"Stiftung Wissenschaft und Politik
German Institute for International and Security Affairs"
SWP is an acronym so  I don't think should be part of the main label at all.

Therefore I believe we should change:
* Primary label: "Stiftung Wissenschaft und Politik, German Institute for International and Security Affairs"
* Label  in German: "Stiftung Wissenschaft und Politik, Deutsches Institut für Internationale Politik und Sicherheit"
and leave the acronym as it is.

@MSpenger do you agree?

---
adambuttrick
02/24/2022, 22:55:09 | 02/24/2022, 22:55:09
comment_text: Giving this a second review: I concur with Arthur's analysis. English and German name forms appear as such on their site, contact information, and copyright statements, so we should use this form.

---
MSpenger
02/25/2022, 07:48:58 | 02/25/2022, 07:48:58
comment_text: I also agree with @arthurpsmith and @adambuttrick .

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:07:38 | 03/17/2022, 22:07:38
comment_text: Record updated in release v1.0.

title:
Modify the information in an existing ROR record: 
Stiftelsen Riksbankens Jubileumsfond https://ror.org/02jkbm893
body:
Summary of request: Modify the information in an existing ROR record

Name of organization: Stiftelsen Riksbankens Jubileumsfond
ROR ID: https://ror.org/02jkbm893
Which part of the record needs to be changed? Primary name, Other names or name versions listed in the record
Description of change: The foundation is listed under its former English name: Bank of Sweden Tercentenary Foundation. I would be grateful if you could change it to the correct version: Stiftelsen Riksbankens Jubileumsfond and also change the wording underneath to For the advancement of the Humanities and Social sciences.

Update: change.name==Stiftelsen Riksbankens Jubileumsfond; replace.labels==Bank of Sweden Tercentenary Foundation*English; add.acronyms==RJ;
comments:
arthurpsmith
12/02/2021, 21:38:08 | 12/02/2021, 21:38:08
comment_text: Going by their English "about" page - https://www.rj.se/en/about-rj2/ the English name they use is "Riksbankens Jubileumsfond", with abbreviation "RJ". The Swedish name we have seems what they use on the Swedish version of that page ("Stiftelsen Riksbankens Jubileumsfond"). Their request regarding "For the advancement of the Humanities and Social sciences" seems confused - unless they consider it part of a full official name (for example we could add "Riksbankens Jubileumsfond For the advancement of the Humanities and Social sciences" as an alternate label I guess) I don't think we have a place for logo text like that in ROR.

So I recommend replacing the primary label with their English label "Riksbankens Jubileumsfond", retaining the Swedish label, adding "RJ' as an acronym, and keeping the former primary label as another alternate label.

---
KellyStathis
01/25/2022, 23:37:42 | 01/25/2022, 23:37:42
comment_text: I'm not sure about removing the word "Stiftelsen" because it doesn't appear on the English version on the website. Arguments for including it:

- From what I can tell, "Stiftelsen" (which means "foundation") is part of their official Swedish name - they may have just thought it was awkward or redundant to translate on the English side? I wouldn't attribute too much significance to that omission. I'm not seeing evidence that "Riksbankens Jubileumsfond" an official "English" name - particularly because it's still Swedish! I think it's just a short name.
- The word "Foundation" is already part of their current English translated name in ROR.
- There are other Swedish foundations in ROR that keep the word "Stiftelsen": https://ror.org/search?query=stiftelsen

My proposal:
- primary name: use the full name, "Stiftelsen Riksbankens Jubileumsfond"
- alias/label: "Riksbankens Jubileumsfond" - if added as a label, I would say it is Swedish for language, not English
- label: "Bank of Sweden Tercentenary Foundation" (English)
- acronyms: "RJ"

For the request on "For the advancement of the Humanities and Social sciences", I think they might be referring to the alias we have, "The Swedish Foundation for Humanities and Social Sciences" - we are missing the word "Advancement". Not sure if we should update this alias or remove it, if we don't normally include taglines like this?

Moving to "Needs discussion."

---
adambuttrick
02/24/2022, 18:31:57 | 02/24/2022, 18:32:20
comment_text: Agree with Kelly's proposal, with one caveat - I don't think we need to add "Riksbankens Jubileumsfond" as an alias or label. It's a substring of the primary name and we don't typically include those as alternate forms. Searching this substring by itself would already returns the full "Stiftelsen Riksbankens Jubileumsfond" name in the API and site. You can see this now by searching for just "Sweden Tercentenary" and returning https://ror.org/02jkbm893.

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:07:08 | 03/17/2022, 22:07:08
comment_text: Record updated in release v1.0.

---

title: Add a new organization to ROR: Biological Museum, Lund University
body:
Summary of request: Add a new organization to ROR

Name of organization: Biological Museum, Lund University 
Website: https://www.biology.lu.se/biological-museum
Organization type: Archive
Link to publications: 
Wikipedia page:
Wikidata ID: Q105086168
ISNI ID:
GRID ID:
Crossref Funder ID:
Other names for the organization: Biologiska Museet, Lunds universitet
Acronym/abbreviation: LD, MZLU
Labels: Biologiska Museet, Lunds universitet*Swedish;
Related organizations: https://ror.org/012a77v79 (parent)
City: Lund
Country: Sweden
Geonames ID: 2693678
Other information about this request: Second largest natural history museum in Sweden
comments:
arthurpsmith
12/06/2021, 20:57:53 | 12/06/2021, 20:57:53
comment_text: This is entirely part of the university, within the Department of Biology, as the website indicates. As not a top-level unit (and not clearly used anywhere as an affiliation) I don't believe this is in scope for ROR at this time.

---
KellyStathis
01/26/2022, 00:15:38 | 01/26/2022, 00:15:38
comment_text: Looking at the [guidance for common organization types](https://github.com/ror-community/ror-updates/wiki/Curator-Evaluation-Workflow:-New-Records#guidance-for-evaluating-common-organization-types), we specify that for a museum within a university, "Add to ROR if: they are producing research and the museum is used as an affiliation." I agree that the  museum by itself is not used as an affiliation - for example, the museum director uses his university affiliation on his ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1259-3363 

However, this feels like a fine line that we're drawing here. The example in the guidance is the UC Berkeley Museum of Vertebrate Zoology (https://ror.org/01rdg4502) - I'm not sure if the difference between these two examples is significant:
- The [UCMVZ website](https://mvz.berkeley.edu/) is also hosted within the UC Berkeley domain, and although it doesn't mention a department, it is a [research unit within the university](https://vcresearch.berkeley.edu/research-units?for=All&search=&rut=All&page=4).
- Both museums are listed in GBIF: [UCMVZ](https://www.gbif.org/grscicoll/institution/59175240-4500-42b9-9e98-42ae299a5e9b/metrics), [Lund University Biological Museum](https://www.gbif.org/grscicoll/institution/13edc77b-7023-4ddd-89c7-d883a480b294)

I do agree that this is not a top-level organization; however, I want to make sure we are consistent. Moving to "needs discussion".

---
adambuttrick
02/24/2022, 18:43:44 | 02/24/2022, 18:43:44
comment_text: The publication affiliation usage pattern for the UC Berkeley Museum of Vertebrate Zoology and the Biological Museum, Lund University are more or less identical :

Biological Museum, Lund University:
https://lucris.lub.lu.se/ws/files/24186691/Kondratyuk_et_al.pdf
https://lucris.lub.lu.se/ws/files/46184553/GS_30_94.pdf
https://www.mapress.com/zt/article/view/zootaxa.5047.3.8

UC Berkeley Museum of Vertebrate Zoology and Biological Museum:
https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1111/mec.13529
https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1111/zsc.12368
http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.580.9635&rep=rep1&type=pdf

If we take UC Berkeley Museum of Vertebrate Zoology and Biological Museum as our guidance/precedent, I'm not sure how we could justify excluding Biological Museum, Lund University. Agree with Kelly that we need to firm this up for the sake of consistency.

---
arthurpsmith
02/28/2022, 17:03:57 | 02/28/2022, 17:03:57
comment_text: I stand corrected, Adam has found some cases where the museum is used directly as an affiliation. So given our criteria I think it does qualify for a ROR after all.

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:29:39 | 03/17/2022, 22:29:39
comment_text: Assigned ROR ID https://ror.org/048555y32 in release v1.0.

---

comments:
adambuttrick
01/28/2022, 01:48:09 | 01/28/2022, 01:48:45
comment_text: Unfortunately, this request isn't as simple as an ISNI change. The current URL in the ROR record points to the University of the French Antilles. The Wikidata ID (https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q829169) points at the University of the French West Indies and Guiana, which appears to have been split into to different entities in 2015 (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University_of_the_French_Antilles). 

So, we need to make a determination if this record represents the historic form of the organization before it split, deprecate it, and create a new record to reflect the University of the French Antilles entry (with the updated ISNI), or pursue some other kind of representation.

---
mariagould
02/28/2022, 17:28:35 | 02/28/2022, 17:28:35
comment_text: There is some backstory to the organization's history in #192. The records we have in ROR currently reflect the fact that University of the French West Indies and Guiana split into two entities in 2015:

University of the French West Indies: https://ror.org/02ryfmr77
University of French Guiana: https://ror.org/00nb39k71

GRID renamed https://ror.org/02ryfmr77 last year. It looks like the older name was stripped from the metadata. I would recommend that we add it as an alias. 

I think the current records are sufficient as far as representation is concerned. 

The main task is to sort out the external IDs:

ISNI: I'm not actually sure that the requestor's suggested ISNI for University of the French West Indies is accurate. It looks like this one might be the primary: https://isni.org/isni/0000000494712972. Perhaps @arthurpsmith can confirm? If this is the case, I would recommend that we go with https://isni.org/isni/0000000494712972 as the "preferred" ID and list the requestor's suggestion and the one currently in the record (http://isni.org/isni/0000000121973053) in "all." 

Wikidata: The Wikidata ID we currently have indicates that it has been replaced by https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q16682075 so we should update the ROR metadata accordingly. We could include the older Wikidata ID in "all." 


---
adambuttrick
02/28/2022, 23:27:26 | 02/28/2022, 23:27:26
comment_text: Example of predecessor/successor relationship

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:07:50 | 03/17/2022, 22:07:50

However, it does appear to be a funder of research, and somehow at least two different researchers are claiming it as an affiliation in publications (note the ORCID relationship is as a "member" of the organization, which seems different from a research affiliation). So while it's not in the Crossref funders database I think this still should be listed in ROR. Moving to "ready".

Other information about this request: For now, we are running as an LLC under my existing org, with the "Patient-Led Research Collaborative" name as a DBA (Doing business as) It's was the simplest we can do to get us up and running as a group! Not sure if we will try to register as a non-profit yet. We see this as a collaborative that may lead to permanent work supporting patient-led research initiatives either ours related to long covid or others. We plan to be around for at least 4 years and are writing with NIH-adjacent organizations for funding. Let me know if you need additional information from us.

So if we add this that should be listed as another name. Note that they don't have a listed place of operation or headquarters, which I guess will come when they are actually registered in some way as an organization? But I don't see a need to delay on this; let's add it to ROR and update when they are more established.

title: Modify the information in an existing ROR record: National mining university of ukraine  (https://ror.org/05hkn5555)
body:
Summary of request: Modify the information in an existing ROR record

Name of organization: National mining university of ukraine 
ROR ID: https://ror.org/05hkn5555
Which part of the record needs to be changed? 
Description of change: Change name to Dnipro University of Technology

Update: change.name==Dnipro University of Technology; add.aliases==National Mining University of Ukraine; delete.labels==Національний гірничий університет України; add.labels==Національний технічний університет «Дніпровська політехніка»*Ukrainian;
comments:
mariagould
05/05/2021, 19:56:38 | 05/05/2021, 19:56:38
comment_text: We received various requests about this university that referred to it as Dnipro University of Technology. This is the name that appears on the university website https://www.nmu.org.ua/en/. However, the history section of the website does not make it clear which name is the current one: https://www.nmu.org.ua/en/content/about_to/stor_ya_un_versitetu/index.php. 

---
arthurpsmith
05/07/2021, 14:33:43 | 05/07/2021, 14:33:43
comment_text: The Ukrainian explanation here: https://www.nmu.org.ua/ua/content/about_to/sogodennya_un_versitetu/about.php (thanks to Google Translate) that the name was changed December 20 2017, and the current official Ukrainian name is "Національний технічний університет «Дніпровська політехніка»" which translates to "National Technical University 'Dnipro Polytechnic'". I guess they haven't fully updated the English portion of the website, except to change the title used at the top of the page to "Dnipro University of Technology", which is what we should go with for the English (and main) label here. But we should add the official Ukrainian name also.

I.e. I recommend to replace the name with "Dnipro University of Technology", add "National Mining University of Ukraine" as an alias, and add "Національний технічний університет «Дніпровська політехніка»" as the Ukrainian name.

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:05:00 | 03/17/2022, 22:05:00
comment_text: Record updated in release v1.0.

comment_text: Note that the name recommended by MG is slightly different than the one they requested. The "research network" part of the name seems to be dropped in most places on their website (both in Polish and English) except for the address section at the bottom of the page. For example on the English about page here: https://iw.lukasiewicz.gov.pl/en/home/aboutus/ it refers to itself as "ŁUKASIEWICZ – The Textile Research Institute". 
So I think both names should be added; the longer one is fine as the main name entry, but the shorter one should be there as an alias. I.e., agree with above but also add:
* Alternate name (English) "Łukasiewicz - Textile Research Institute"
* Alternate name (Polish) "Łukasiewicz - Instytut Włókiennictwa"
Also:
* Wikidata ID: https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q11713259
* Wikipedia page (Poilish): https://pl.wikipedia.org/wiki/Instytut_Włókiennictwa

title: Add a new organization to ROR:  Magnetics Information Consortium (MagIC) Data Repository
body:
Summary of request: Add a new organization to ROR

Name of organization: Magnetics Information Consortium (MagIC) Data Repository
Website: https://earthref.org/MagIC
Link to publications: 
Wikipedia page: 
Wikidata ID: 
ISNI ID: 
GRID ID: 
Crossref Funder ID: 
Ringgold ID: 
Other names for the organization: 
Acronym/abbreviation: 
Related organizations: 
City: 
Country: 
Other information about this request: We are a paleo and rock magnetic data repository supported by the NSF (https://www.earthref.org/MagIC). We would like to register with ROR in particular to use a ROR id in our data set schema.org headers and DataCite entries.
comments:
mariagould
04/27/2021, 13:15:58 | 04/27/2021, 13:15:58
comment_text: I think this should be added but perhaps we should create the ID for Earthref instead of for the repository itself?

---
arthurpsmith
04/29/2021, 13:49:25 | 04/29/2021, 13:49:25
comment_text: I've looked through several publications referencing MagIC and as far as I can tell it is NOT used as an affiliation by the authors, rather they list just their home universities (UCSD or OSU, see the "core group" on their about page). They don't use Earthref either as an affiliation, so I don't think going to that level helps the case.

Going by our curation policy document for the in-scope questions:
* Yes it is involved in research in some way (providing software and data services for that community)
* No, I don't see it used as an affiliation in existing publications
* I don't see the members of the consortium using it as an affiliation
* Domain name is not standalone (but we don't have earthref.org either as noted above)
* Do we have similar organizations already? Maybe - Qualitative Data Repository: https://ror.org/014trz974 or IRIS consortium - https://ror.org/05xkn9s74
* Yes, it's definitely a consortium with multiple people involved at multiple institutions
* Copyright statement references Earthref.org and not MagIC specifically
* It's been around since 2003 so appears stable and well-established, though dependent on NSF funding
* Yes there are multiple parents.

So it meets about 1/2 our criteria. Is the lack of use as an affiliation disqualifying? I'm not sure on this one. Maybe this needs more discussion?

---
arthurpsmith
05/17/2021, 18:13:17 | 05/17/2021, 18:13:17
comment_text: Ok, I think after our discussion last week and review of the examples list this clearly does qualify. I'm moving it into the "ready for sign-off" column!

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:28:04 | 03/17/2022, 22:28:04
comment_text: Assigned ROR ID https://ror.org/00f89wy98 in release v1.0.

Other information about this request:
comments:
mariagould
05/14/2021, 22:58:52 | 05/14/2021, 22:59:18
comment_text: This appears to be related to https://ror.org/01f74x078 but it's not clear to what extent it is an independent entity. Therefore I am not sure if it is in scope or not.

---
arthurpsmith
05/17/2021, 19:50:41 | 05/17/2021, 19:50:41
comment_text: Good question on it being an independent entity. According to this page: https://nau.edu.ua/ua/menu/un%D1%96versitet/polozhennya-srukturnih-pidrozdiliv.html
it is one of the "separate structural subdivisions" which includes a museum and some "colleges" and an "academy". The museum has a wikipedia page: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ukraine_State_Aviation_Museum which suggests it is quite independent (no ROR for it though). I also looked at one of the colleges: https://uk.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%92%D0%B0%D1%81%D0%B8%D0%BB%D1%8C%D0%BA%D1%96%D0%B2%D1%81%D1%8C%D0%BA%D0%B8%D0%B9_%D0%BA%D0%BE%D0%BB%D0%B5%D0%B4%D0%B6_%D0%9D%D0%B0%D1%86%D1%96%D0%BE%D0%BD%D0%B0%D0%BB%D1%8C%D0%BD%D0%BE%D0%B3%D0%BE_%D0%B0%D0%B2%D1%96%D0%B0%D1%86%D1%96%D0%B9%D0%BD%D0%BE%D0%B3%D0%BE_%D1%83%D0%BD%D1%96%D0%B2%D0%B5%D1%80%D1%81%D0%B8%D1%82%D0%B5%D1%82%D1%83 - it existed independently for a time before becoming part of the NAU, so again somewhat independent but not really now.

Given that the area of expertise for this institute (design and ergonomics) seems quite separate from the aviation emphasis of the university as a whole, it seems to me justifiable to give this one its own ROR. But I'd be ok with a decision to just use the parent university ROR for this also. Note that I can't find it in Wikidata or ISNI.

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:28:21 | 03/17/2022, 22:28:21
comment_text: Assigned ROR ID https://ror.org/04pd1hv08 in release v1.0.

Chernihiv National Pedagogical University named after Taras Shevchenko (https://ror.org/024ykzk09)
body:
Summary of request: Modify the information in an existing ROR record

Name of organization: Chernihiv National Pedagogical University named after Taras Shevchenko
ROR ID: https://ror.org/024ykzk09
Which part of the record needs to be changed? 
Description of change: Our HEI changed its name. Now it is T.H. Shevchenko National University "Chernihiv Colehium". Links: 1) https://nuchk4world.wixsite.com/nuchkerasmus; 2) https://drive.google.com/file/d/17orUhP0LXhD8AYFK1b9dEwGsZndoGrO8/view (Charter of the HEI, from the page 35 in English)

Note from reviewer:
Also add Ukrainian label: Національного університету "Чернігівській колегіум" імені Т.Г. Шевченка

Update: add.labels==Національного університету "Чернігівській колегіум" імені Т.Г. Шевченка*Ukrainian;
comments:
arthurpsmith
06/02/2021, 14:57:32 | 06/02/2021, 14:57:32
comment_text: This seems straightforward given the reference to the new English version of the name. We should also add the official Ukrainian name which I've attached to the main description above. However, there seems to be some disagreement on transliteration of Ukrainian 'Г' characters into English as 'H' or 'G' - Google Translate and other sources seem to insist that it's "T.G. Shevchenko", not "T. H.", and that it  should be "Collegium", not "Colehium". Wikipedia has the poet's name as 'Taras Hryhorovych Shevchenko' though which implies sticking with the 'H'. So let's leave it this way I guess.

---
mariagould
10/01/2021, 13:21:42 | 10/01/2021, 13:21:42
comment_text: It looks as though the primary name was updated in the September GRID/ROR release but the Ukrainian name still needs to be added so I will keep this request active. 

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:05:22 | 03/17/2022, 22:05:22

body:

Which part of the record needs to be changed? Primary name, Other names or name versions listed in the record, Organization website, Other IDs for the organization, Organization type, Something else
Description of change: According to the Order of the Ministry of Health and Social Development of the Russian Federation No.434 dated 28.04.2012, the Pyatigorsk State Pharmaceutical Academy is attached to the Volgograd State Medical University as a separate subdivision (branch).
Its label was changed to Pyatigorsk Medical and Pharmaceutical Institute - branch of Volgograd State Medical University.
The institute has recently received a new ISNI - https://isni.org/isni/0000000503828740
Wikipedia - https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%9F%D1%8F%D1%82%D0%B8%D0%B3%D0%BE%D1%80%D1%81%D0%BA%D0%B8%D0%B9_%D0%BC%D0%B5%D0%B4%D0%B8%D0%BA%D0%BE-%D1%84%D0%B0%D1%80%D0%BC%D0%B0%D1%86%D0%B5%D0%B2%D1%82%D0%B8%D1%87%D0%B5%D1%81%D0%BA%D0%B8%D0%B9_%D0%B8%D0%BD%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B8%D1%82%D1%83%D1%82
Wikidata - https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q52637580
New official website - http://www.pmedpharm.ru/

Related organizations: https://ror.org/04q6a0352 (parent)


Update: change.name==Pyatigorsk Medical and Pharmaceutical Institute - branch of Volgograd State Medical University; add.labels==Пятигорский медико-фармацевтический институт – филиал Волгоградского государственного медицинского университет*Russian; delete.labels==Пятигорская государственная фармацевтическая академия; add.aliases==Пятигорская государственная фармацевтическая академия; add.aliases==Pyatigorsk State Pharmaceutical Academy; replace.ISNI==0000 0005 0382 8740; replace.links==http://www.pmedpharm.ru/; add.Wikidata==Q4385790;
comments:
arthurpsmith
12/02/2021, 21:54:59 | 12/02/2021, 21:54:59
comment_text: We definitely had an out of date name for this - it changed in 2013 or maybe 2016 at latest. The website link we had is dead (the new website they propose is fine). The change in ISNI seems ok; the new Wikidata ID they propose isn't the right one - I've corrected it in the notes below.

When we can we should link this ROR id to its parent: https://ror.org/04q6a0352

So changes needed here are (I think this is straightforward):
* Primary label: Pyatigorsk Medical and Pharmaceutical Institute - branch of Volgograd State Medical University
* Label in Russian: Пятигорский медико-фармацевтический институт – филиал Волгоградского государственного медицинского университета
* Move current English and Russian labels to alternate labels
* Change ISNI to https://isni.org/isni/0000000503828740
* Change website to http://www.pmedpharm.ru/
* Add Wikidata ID https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q4385790
* When possible link to parent ROR: https://ror.org/04q6a0352

title:
Modify the information in an existing ROR record: 
Ansgar Bibelskole https://ror.org/05y8hw592
body:
Summary of request: Modify the information in an existing ROR record

Name of organization: Ansgar Bibelskole
ROR ID: https://ror.org/05y8hw592
Which part of the record needs to be changed? Primary name, Organization website
Description of change: Change Ansgar Bibelskole to Ansgar University College https://ansgarhoyskole.no/

Update: change.name==Ansgar University College; add.aliases==Ansgar Bible School; add.labels==Ansgar høyskole*no; add.acronyms==AS;
comments:
arthurpsmith
09/07/2021, 13:23:36 | 09/07/2021, 13:23:36
comment_text: I do not think these are the same organization, although they are clearly related:
https://ansgarhoyskole.no/om-skolen/skolens-organisering
The existing "Bibelskole" website does not redirect to the "ansgarhoyskole.no" site, it seems to be continuing under that name.
It may be they want to create a new ROR id for the "University College". Or maybe all "Ansgar" should be replaced by a top-level organization, but I'm not sure what. Here's the Google translate English version of the central portion of the "organisering" page, which I am having trouble making sense of:

"From 1 January 2006, Ansgar University College is registered as a subsidiary of Ansgar Høgskole AS under the limited liability group Ansgarskolen AS, which is also registered in the Brønnøysund registers from the same date. The limited liability group consists of the four companies Ansgar høyskole AS, Ansgar Drift og Eiendom AS, Ansgar bibelskole AS and Ansgar Sommerhotell AS. All shares in the group are owned by Misjonskirken Norge."

Is the relevant top-level organization "Ansgar Høgskole AS", "Ansgarskolen AS" or perhaps just "Misjonskirken Norge" (the sponsoring church)?

Anyway, it seems clear that "Ansgar Høgskole AS", of which "Ansgar University College" is part, is different from "Ansgar Bibelskole AS", so  the substance of this request should not proceed as requested in my view, and something different needs to be done here. Just not sure what. Maybe go back to the requester for more detail on what the relationships are and what we should list?

---
mariagould
12/02/2021, 19:24:16 | 12/02/2021, 19:24:16
comment_text: I'm seeing Ansgar University College used as an affiliation (e.g., https://www.ingentaconnect.com/content/intellect/ijcm/2017/00000010/00000001/art00006). From what I can tell, the Bible school is a subsidiary and/or predecessor. Although the bible school website doesn't redirect to the university college site, the website footer does list https://ansgarhoyskole.no/ as the main contact. So I would recommend that we:

1. Update the primary name in the record to "Ansgar University College"
2. Add "Ansgar Bible School" as an alias
3.  Add the Norwegian name "Ansgar høyskole"
4. Add "AS" as an acronym

---
carlyrobinson
12/03/2021, 20:36:03 | 12/03/2021, 20:36:03
comment_text: I agree with @mariagould suggestion. It would be great to confirm with someone familiar (whether the requestor or someone in ROR community. 

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:06:37 | 03/17/2022, 22:06:37
comment_text: Record updated in release v1.0.

title:
Add a new organization to ROR: 
 
Institute for Research in Biomedicine (IRB)
body:
Summary of request: Add a new organization to ROR

Name of organization: Institute for Research in Biomedicine (IRB)
Website: https://www.irb.usi.ch/
Link to publications: 10.1021/acs.jmedchem.1c00852
Organization type: Nonprofit (A non-profit and non-governmental organization involved in conducting or funding research)
Wikipedia page: 
Wikidata ID: 
ISNI ID: https://isni.org/isni/0000000405092792
GRID ID: 
Crossref Funder ID: 
Other names for the organization: Istituto di Ricerca in Biomedicina
Acronym/abbreviation: IRB
Related organizations: Parent: https://ror.org/03c4atk17
City: Bellinzona
Country: Switzerland
Year established: 2000
How will a ROR ID for this organization be used? To identify affiliations for research publications, To identify affiliations for datasets, To acknowledge research funders, To acknowledge a research facility, To be integrated in a scholarly publishing system
Other information about this request:
comments:
arthurpsmith
10/22/2021, 15:27:13 | 10/22/2021, 15:27:13
comment_text: Clearly a significant research organization. However, as the "About page" notes, "Since 2009, the IRB is affiliated with the Università della Svizzera italiana (USI)" and the website domain is now under the university's domain, and the university logo is displayed on the site (but there's not much other mention of it). ROR id for the university is https://ror.org/03c4atk17. I notice that on the referenced publication, all the researchers with this affiliation include both this institute and the university as part of their affiliation statement. Is it really separate? I guess it was from 2000-2009 so maybe that's enough justification. Possibly arguable as to whether this really qualifies as "top level" now, but nonetheless I think it should have its own ROR id.

---
nlundvick
12/11/2021, 19:01:29 | 12/11/2021, 19:01:29
comment_text: Scholarly research is conducted at the institute and published using the institute as an affiliation (jointly with the  the Università della Svizzera italiana (USI), as noted by first curator). Copyright to the website is owned by institute, not USI. The institute has multiple research groups and facilities, and the "People" page seems to indicates that it is somewhat autonomous from USI, having it's own support and administrative staff. Add to ROR with USI as parent organization.

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:29:25 | 03/17/2022, 22:29:25
comment_text: Assigned ROR ID https://ror.org/05gfswd81 in release v1.0.

title: Add Research Centre of the Slovenian Academy of Sciences and Arts
body:
Summary: Add a new organization to ROR
Name of organization: Research Centre of the Slovenian Academy of Sciences and Arts
Name in Slovenian:  Znanstvenoraziskovalni center Slovenske akademije znanosti in umetnosti (ZRC SAZU) 
Website: https://www.zrc-sazu.si/
Wikipedia URL (Slovenian): https://sl.wikipedia.org/wiki/Znanstvenoraziskovalni_center_Slovenske_akademije_znanosti_in_umetnosti
Wikidata ID: Q15977604
ISNI: https://isni.org/isni/0000000121765262
Related organizations: https://ror.org/04evj0n95 (related)

Information about this request: 
We are upgrading our repository for research data, incorporating new standards and technologies. New repository will be based on Open Linked Data philosophy, so we need to describe important objects – like Agents entities – with Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI). 

we are aware that the Slovenian Academy of Sciences and Arts (https://ror.org/04evj0n95) is already registered in ROR. However, our Research Centre of the Slovenian Academy of Sciences and Arts is an autonomous legal entity with different mission and scope. Therefore we kindly ask you to enter the Research Centre of the Slovenian Academy of Sciences and Arts into the ROR as well.
comments:
arthurpsmith
05/18/2021, 13:46:29 | 05/18/2021, 13:46:29
comment_text: I added a wikipedia link and the Wikidata and ISNI ids. Note that (from the Sovenian wikipedia page) this research institute contains 17 sub-units including an apparently prominent "Institute of Philosophy" which is included as one of the names ISNI lists for this institute.

Anyway, this seems to clearly meet our criteria for a ROR id, so I recommend it be added.

---
carlyrobinson
07/12/2021, 15:10:51 | 07/12/2021, 15:10:51
comment_text: Agree, it should be added to ROR.

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:28:19 | 03/17/2022, 22:28:19
comment_text: Assigned ROR ID https://ror.org/04zvj8c18 in release v1.0.

Related organizations: DFO - ROR: 02qa1x782 (related institution: OBSERVER MEMBERS), UQAR - ROR: 049jtt335 (related institution: ACTIVE MEMBERS), TMQ - ROR: 01ncvjw08 (related institution: ASSOCIATE MEMBERS), CRBM - ROR: 01aa78f69 (related institution: ASSOCIATE MEMBERS), MUN - ROR: 04haebc03 (related institution: ACTIVE MEMBERS), UQTR - ROR: 02xrw9r68 (related institution: ACTIVE MEMBERS), Shipping Federation of Canada - ROR: 0515hsf31 (related institution: ASSOCIATE MEMBERS), WWF Canada - ROR: 020tdv696 (ASSOCIATE MEMBERS)
https://ror.org/02qa1x782 (related)
https://ror.org/049jtt335 (related)
https://ror.org/01ncvjw08 (related)
https://ror.org/01aa78f69 (related)
https://ror.org/04haebc03 (related)
https://ror.org/02xrw9r68 (related)
https://ror.org/0515hsf31 (related)
https://ror.org/020tdv696 (related)
City: Rimouski
Country: Canada
Other information about this request:
comments:
KellyStathis
07/30/2021, 19:54:46 | 07/30/2021, 19:54:46
comment_text: This organization supports and conducts oceans research, and hosts a repository for oceans data. It is not already in ROR, and it is used as an affiliation (see links in submission).

It is also a top-level organization. SLGO is part of the [Canadian Integrated Oceans Observing System (CIOOS)](https://cioos.ca/), along with CIOOS Atlantic and CIOOS Pacific: https://ogsl.ca/en/cioos/. However, SLGO is an independent organization from CIOOS and predates CIOOS. I checked with a colleague and we are not sure if [CIOOS Atlantic](https://cioosatlantic.ca/) and [CIOOS Pacific](https://cioospacific.ca/) are equally independent, but SLGO definitely is.

In addition to adding SLGO, I would also recommend adding CIOOS (the national organization) to ROR. We may still indicate a "parent" relationship here, in that SLGO is one of the three partner "regional associations" that together form the national CIOOS. See the governance structure here - https://www.cioos.ca/governance/.

A few metadata notes:

- For the related organizations submitted, I am not sure if it makes sense to list all of these members here. There are many more members listed on this page: https://ogsl.ca/en/members-list/. This seems like it would be difficult to maintain. 
- For the labels: I would not capitalize "global" in "Observatoire global du Saint-Laurent".

I recommend adding SLGO to ROR.

---
arthurpsmith
08/03/2021, 14:15:05 | 08/03/2021, 14:15:05
comment_text: I agree with Kelly here - SLGO/OGSL is an independent research organization that should be in ROR. I did not find any Wikidata/Wikipedia or ISNI entries for it; however several people (data scientists) list it as their employer in LinkedIn.  I also agree that it would make sense to add an entry for CIOOS.

---
pauline-chauvet
02/17/2022, 21:50:32 | 02/17/2022, 21:50:32

Thanks very much for your work. 
Pauline Chauvet
chauvetp@ogsl.ca

title:
Add a new organization to ROR: 
 
Multiscale Bioimaging
body:
Summary of request: Add a new organization to ROR

Name of organization: Multiscale Bioimaging
Website: https://mbexc.de/
Link to publications: https://mbexc.uni-goettingen.de/literature
Organization type: Education
Wikipedia page: 
Wikidata ID: https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q96756740
ISNI ID: 
GRID ID: 
Crossref Funder ID: 
Other names for the organization: EXC 2067: Multiscale Bioimaging: from Molecular Machines to Networks of Excitable Cells
Acronym/abbreviation: MBExC
Related organizations: https://ror.org/01y9bpm73 (parent)
City: Göttingen
Country: Germany
Other information about this request:
comments:
arthurpsmith
07/13/2021, 13:50:32 | 07/13/2021, 13:50:32
comment_text: While this meets some of our criteria, I believe it does not qualify for a ROR at this time for the following reasons:
1. It is a research project within the University of Göttingen, and when used as an affiliation the university is always included as part of the affiliation from the cases I've looked at; in fact authors usually directly reference the university (perhaps with a department), and not this project, as their affiliation. They do seem to acknowledge this project as a funding source.
2. I don't believe these are intended to be long-term organizations; this one has existed only since 2019. More information on the German "Clusters of Excellence" (there are 57 right now) here: https://www.research-in-germany.org/en/research-landscape/excellence-universities/clusters-of-excellence.html

*However* we do have at least 2 of the Clusters of Excellence in ROR right now, so on the grounds that we have included these before it could be argued this one qualifies also:
https://ror.org/05tbc9841 - Cluster of Excellence "Matters of Activity. Image Space Material" at Humboldt University Berlin
https://ror.org/034waa237 - Cluster of Excellence on Plant Sciences at University of Dusseldorf.

---
MSpenger
08/03/2021, 10:30:33 | 08/03/2021, 15:04:31
comment_text: I agree with Arthur and this topic should also be discussed within the ROR curation team.

Here are some more details on Clusters of Excellence
- they have a duration of seven years (with possibility of renewal) and are associated with a host institution
- information from the DFG "Clusters of excellence enable German university locations to establish internationally visible, competitive research and training facilities, thereby enhancing scientific networking and cooperation among the participating institutions. Clusters of excellence should form an important part of a university's strategic and thematic planning, significantly raise its profile and reflect its considered long-term priorities." https://www.dfg.de/en/research_funding/programmes/excellence_initiative/clusters_excellence/index.html

there are already some more Clusters of Excellence in ROR, which would make a case for including "Multiscale Bioimaging" :
- https://ror.org/05874db82 - Excellence Cluster Universe -> replaced by ORIGINS (https://ror.org/010wkny21)
- https://ror.org/04c4bwh63 - Cologne Excellence Cluster on Cellular Stress Responses in Aging Associated Diseases
- https://ror.org/02wkzzr31 - Nanoscale Microscopy and Molecular Physiology of the Brain Cluster of Excellence 171
- https://ror.org/025z3z560 - Munich Cluster for Systems Neurology

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:28:30 | 03/17/2022, 22:28:30
comment_text: Assigned ROR ID https://ror.org/05xy1nn52 in release v1.0.

title:
Modify the information in an existing ROR record: 
Technische Universität Ilmenau https://ror.org/01weqhp73
body:
Summary of request: Modify the information in an existing ROR record

Name of organization: Technische Universität Ilmenau
ROR ID: https://ror.org/01weqhp73
Which part of the record needs to be changed? Primary name, Other names or name versions listed in the record, Organization website
Description of change: 
NAME: Technische Universität Ilmenau; 
ALIAS: TU Ilmenau; 
Website: https://www.tu-ilmenau.de/   
There is no translation of the name allowed.

Begründung:
https://www.tu-ilmenau.de/universitaet/quicklinks/universitaetsbibliothek/forschen-publizieren/hinweise-zum-publizieren/empfehlungen-zur-sichtbarkeit
Entsprechend der „Verzeichnung wissenschaftlicher Publikationen in fachlichen und fachübergreifenden Informationsquellen: gemeinsame Empfehlungen des Rektorats und der Universitätsbibliothek der TU Ilmenau“
https://www.tu-ilmenau.de/fileadmin/Bereiche/UB/Dokumente/Forschen_Publizieren/OpenAccess/TU-Ilmenau_Sichtbarkeit-Hinweise_Empfehlungen.pdf
 
„Die institutionelle Zugehörigkeit („Affiliation“) ist bei jeder Publikation in einheitlicher und vollständiger Form anzugeben.
Bei allen Veröffentlichungen, die ganz oder teilweise auf Forschungstätigkeit an der TU Ilmenau zurückgehen, ist die institutionelle Zugehörigkeit in folgender Form anzugeben:
„Technische Universität Ilmenau“ oder „TU Ilmenau“.
Für ergänzende Angaben zu Fachgebieten oder Instituten sind die jeweils offiziellen Bezeichnungen zu verwenden, wahlweise in deutscher oder englischer Fassung.“

Other information about this request: If the German correct name ist not allowed, please use the shortname" TU Ilmenau"

MG Note:
Change name: Technische Universität Ilmenau
Replace aliases: TU Ilmenau
Replace links: https://www.tu-ilmenau.de/ 

Update: change.name==Technische Universität Ilmenau; replace.aliases==TU Ilmenau; replace.links==https://www.tu-ilmenau.de/;
comments:
arthurpsmith
09/07/2021, 13:31:23 | 09/07/2021, 13:31:23
comment_text: Their English web pages uniformly use "TU Ilmenau" as the name, so I'd be in favor of putting that as the principle name for ROR. The official German name would be ok too, with "TU Ilmenau" as an alias.
Note the request to also change the website link to the main page - we should do that also.

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:06:33 | 03/17/2022, 22:06:33
comment_text: Record updated in release v1.0.

(related)
City: Little Rock
Country: United States
Year established: 2010
How will a ROR ID for this organization be used? To identify affiliations for datasets
Other information about this request: The Cancer Imaging Archive (TCIA) is a data publisher of cancer related images and supporting data that is funded by NIH/NCI, managed by the Frederick National Laboratory for Cancer Research and hosted and operated by the University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences. TCIA has an advisory board that approves TCIA hosted imaging collections. TCIA is a trusted repository for Nature Scientific Data, Medical Physics and other journals. As such, TCIA needs its own ROR.

09/03/2021, 23:32:23 | 09/03/2021, 23:32:23
comment_text: I agree we should make this change as indicated. Would we move the English translated name to the alias field, or remove it entirely?

comments:
adambuttrick
01/13/2022, 00:45:14 | 01/15/2022, 02:32:31
comment_text: This appears to be an organization that hosts conferences and has, for the last seven years, published a journal, SYNCROINFO (http://media-publisher.eu/synchroinfo-journal/) focused on synchronization, signal shaping and processing. It is not already in ROR. 

-is associated with research publications and/or other activities, as evidenced as its use as an affiliation on the following works:

https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/abstract/document/9619169
https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/abstract/document/9619185
https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/9619176

Potential issues include that the journal's start date precedes the org's start date by four years (2015 vs. 2019) and a seemingly small number of persons affiliated.

---
arthurpsmith
01/31/2022, 18:49:45 | 01/31/2022, 18:49:45
comment_text: I added Wikidata and ISNI id's for this. The related organization "Media Publisher LLC" seems to be based in Russia - see https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q110586198 for example - I assume that was where the journal started, before IRIS was organized. Maybe the organizers moved from Moscow to Vienna in or before 2019?

All that might put me in favor of waiting on this one, but they are publishing in IEEE journals, so in the end I think we should proceed with adding this to ROR now.

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:30:29 | 03/17/2022, 22:30:29
comment_text: Assigned ROR ID https://ror.org/04yy4tq26 in release v1.0.

title:
Modify the information in an existing ROR record: 
Institut de Physique du Globe de Paris https://ror.org/004gzqz66
body:
Summary of request: Modify the information in an existing ROR record

Name of organization: Institut de Physique du Globe de Paris
ROR ID: https://ror.org/004gzqz66
Which part of the record needs to be changed? Primary name, Other names or name versions listed in the record, Organization website
Description of change: The primary name is lowercase (except Paris) "Institut de physique du globe de Paris". 

The English name is "Paris institute of earth physics"

Website: https://www.ipgp.fr

Update: change.name==Institut de physique du globe de Paris; replace.labels==Paris Institute of Earth Physics*English; replace.links==https://www.ipgp.fr/; delete.aliases==Paris Institute of Earth Physics;
comments:
arthurpsmith
12/23/2021, 19:53:14 | 12/23/2021, 19:53:14
comment_text: To confirm this capitalization request is how it is displayed by the organization itself, see this page: http://www.ipgp.jussieu.fr/en/governance
But for example in affiliations the other words do seem to typically be capitalized - for example the affiliations in this article: https://agupubs.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1029/2012GL052387
Anyway, as the organization has requested the capitalization change I think we should accept it.

On the English name, I can't find "Paris Institute of Earth Physics" or the lower-case version they request anywhere on their website. Wikidata does use "Paris Institute of Earth Physics" as the English label though. This does seem a better translation of the name than the current one we have, so since they requested it I'm fine with making that change.

As to the website - both our current url and the one they request work and provide exactly the same set of web pages, and both on their contact page suggest 'ipgp.fr' is the correct domain now, so I agree we should switch to the shorter URL for the website.

So, recommended changes are:
* primary label should be "Institut de physique du globe de Paris"
* English label should be "Paris Institute of Earth Physics"
* Website should be https://www.ipgp.fr

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:07:52 | 03/17/2022, 22:07:52
comment_text: Record updated in release v1.0.

title:
Modify the information in an existing ROR record: 
Universität der Bundeswehr München https://ror.org/05kkv3f82
body:
Summary of request: Modify the information in an existing ROR record

Name of organization: Universität der Bundeswehr München
ROR ID: https://ror.org/05kkv3f82
Which part of the record needs to be changed? Primary name, Other names or name versions listed in the record
Description of change: The primary and official name is the german form "Universität der Bundeswehr München" . The English translation is "University of the Bundeswehr Munich"

**Final decision per curator discussion (MG):**
- Change primary name to `Universität der Bundeswehr München`
- Add English `en` name: `University of the Bundeswehr Munich`
- Add acronym `UniBw M`

Update: change.name==Universität der Bundeswehr München; replace.labels==University of the Bundeswehr Munich*English; add.acronyms==UniBw M;
comments:
MSpenger
12/07/2021, 14:11:44 | 12/07/2021, 14:11:44
comment_text: Looks correct. Name change according to corporate wording:
```

"name":"Universität der Bundeswehr München"

"labels":[{"label":"University of the Bundeswehr Munich","iso639":"en"}]
```

---
arthurpsmith
12/07/2021, 14:43:01 | 12/07/2021, 14:43:01
comment_text: I'm ok with this but I'm wondering, don't we have a policy to  prefer the English version of a name if there is an official one? Anyway, we have  plenty  of  German primary names on other organizations  so this is fine.

---
mariagould
12/22/2021, 19:27:15 | 12/22/2021, 19:27:15
comment_text: If the organization has a policy against using the English version of the name as an official name, we would default to the original language. I'm not sure of the situation in this case. I'm also wondering about the English version of the name itself: would it be "University of the Bundeswehr Munich" or "University of the Federal Armed Forces Munich"?

---
arthurpsmith
12/23/2021, 19:18:41 | 12/23/2021, 19:18:41
comment_text: The English web page of the university - https://www.unibw.de/home-en - uses the German name - "Universität der Bundeswehr München" everywhere. Although they also have an acronym version they use too: "UniBw M" which it would probably be good for ROR to add. So maybe we should just drop this English label altogether? It's not clear from the request that the university was actually asking us to use their "translation" rather than just telling us a translation??

---
mariagould
01/12/2022, 00:59:21 | 01/12/2022, 00:59:21
comment_text: I agree we should add the German acronym. As to dropping the English entirely, I would err on the side of including an English version. @MSpenger do you have any insights as to which English version of the name should be used ( "University of the Bundeswehr Munich" or "University of the Federal Armed Forces Munich") or whether it would be best to omit an English version altogether?

---
MSpenger
01/12/2022, 14:09:39 | 01/12/2022, 14:09:39
comment_text: Also +1 for the acronym.  If an English name should be added, I would stick to "Bundeswehr University Munich" as it seems to be the most used English version and is also used in Wikidata: https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q283099 



---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:07:40 | 03/17/2022, 22:07:40

title:
Modify the information in an existing ROR record: 
Phoenix Hospital Chelmsford https://ror.org/03jasrp23
body:
Summary of request: Modify the information in an existing ROR record

Name of organization: Phoenix Hospital Chelmsford
ROR ID: https://ror.org/03jasrp23
Which part of the record needs to be changed? Organization website
Description of change: Website merge. Updated URL - https://www.phoenixhospitalgroup.com/our-locations/phoenix-hospital-chelmsford/
We also need the 'other name' changed from 'Baddow Hospital' To Phoenix Hospital Group

MG Note:
Replace links: https://www.phoenixhospitalgroup.com/our-locations/phoenix-hospital-chelmsford/
Add Wikidata ID: Q88222461 (preferred)

Update: replace.links==https://www.phoenixhospitalgroup.com/our-locations/phoenix-hospital-chelmsford/; add.Wikidata==Q88222461;
comments:
arthurpsmith
12/02/2021, 20:22:57 | 12/02/2021, 20:22:57
comment_text: So the question to me here is whether we should make this ROR the id for the top-level organization (which seems relatively new) - "Phoenix Hospital Group". This top-level org has Phoenix Hospital Chelmsford as a subsidiary, but also Weymouth Street Hospital and a couple of additional clinics (based on their website). We don't have a ROR for any of these right now, only this one for the Chelmsford location.

The website we currently have redirects to the main "phoenixhospitalgroup.com" page now. There is also a new Wikidata ID for the Chelmsford hospital: Q88222461, and Q88222468 for "Phoenix Hospital Group", also Q20714162 for Weymouth Street Hospital.

If we keep this as just the id for the Chelmsford hospital then I think we should also keep the name "Baddow Hospital" as an alias for historical purposes as we do in other cases where a name has changed. We can add "Phoenix Hospital Group" also as an alias and adjust the website as requested, assuming we don't create a new id for "Phoenix Hospital Group" separately. Not sure on this - I guess the minimal change is to go ahead as requested without creating new id's or changing to top level rght now.

---
KellyStathis
01/25/2022, 23:17:03 | 01/25/2022, 23:17:03
comment_text: I agree we should keep this record specific to the Chelmsford location. However, if we do that, I'm not sure about adding "Phoenix Hospital Group" as an alias when it's really the parent org. I would propose creating a new ROR ID for the parent instead.

Side question on our process - do we update Wikidata when we update/add new ROR IDs? I noticed that the Baddow Hospital Wikidata page (Q30292854) references this ROR ID, but it isn't on the Chelmsford hospital Wikidata page (Q88222461) - we could add it there too.

Moving to "Needs discussion".

---
mariagould
02/11/2022, 00:38:31 | 02/11/2022, 00:38:31
comment_text: I agree with Kelly that we should keep this record specific to the Chelmsford location. We should also add the Wikidata ID for Chelmsford hospital (Q88222461), and keep Baddow as an alias.

I'm a little wary of creating new records for corporate parent entities like hospital groups without documented use cases for ROR IDs. I'll add this as a discussion topic for a future meeting. 

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:07:06 | 03/17/2022, 22:07:06
comment_text: Record updated in release v1.0.

---

I don't think we want to add all 84 to ROR. I spot-checked a handful of them and could find none currently in ROR, though we may have some of them. I think this one is technically a subsidiary of "CSIRO Land & Water" - https://ror.org/057xz1h85 - but I don't know if that would be included in any affiliation for a researcher at this facility. Anyway, given they have no publications as yet I recommend we either put this on hold until there's more research output associated with it, or probably better to just say no as it is not a top-level research org which ROR is focused on right now.

---
KellyStathis
02/08/2022, 20:15:25 | 02/08/2022, 20:15:25
comment_text: I agree that keeping the CSIRO entries in ROR at the level of the [business units](https://www.csiro.au/en/about/people/business-units) like Land and Water makes sense, rather than adding all 84 labs.

Leaving this in second review as I'm not sure about making the final call to decline.

---
alslib
02/11/2022, 01:19:53 | 02/11/2022, 01:21:39
comment_text: Hi folks, I would appreciate a reconsideration of this submission please.
The use case is the acknowledgement of the use of a facility. Facilities in CSIRO are "managed" by a specific business unit, but may be used by anyone in the organisation, or researchers external to CSIRO. This use case is not about affiliation of the authors.
We note the inclusion of a ROR in the Acknowledgements section of this journal article, https://doi.org/10.1093/mnras/stab1823, to acknowledge the use of National Energy Research Scientific Computing Center; this is a use case for facilities, "research resources" in ORCID's language, with the potential to push metadata of successful proposals to a researcher's ORCID record, and to support the tracking of publications that acknowledge the use of such facilities.
Regards
Anne Stevenson, CSIRO Research Data Services
anne.stevenson@csiro.au

---
adambuttrick
02/11/2022, 01:38:56 | 02/11/2022, 01:38:56
comment_text: Thank you for these details, @alslib. We will review further accordingly. 

---
mpfl
02/11/2022, 04:01:37 | 02/11/2022, 04:12:58
comment_text: Hello! I'm not on the review team but the Australian Research Data Commons is watching this thread with great interest. I'm not sure if Australia has a strange model, but we have quite a few "national facilities" that are administered as sub-units or sub-sub-units of other organisations. These national facilities are often funded at a national and/or state level, but are administered through existing organisations.

Despite the way they are administered, they have their own identity and can be used by any researcher. Reiterating @alslib's point, the particular use case here is around tracking the acknowledgements/citations of those facilities and all of the instruments/services belonging to that facility.

An example is the John de Laeter Centre (JdLC) here Perth, Western Australia. The JdLC reports through Curtin University's Faculty of Science and Engineering, but the JdLC itself is a national-scale facility that attracts state and national funding to house instruments and provide services to all researchers, not just those at Curtin University. It does some of its own original research, but most research undertaken using its instruments is undertaken by researchers _not_ based there. I know for a fact that the Director of the JdLC is always looking for up-to-date evidence of usage.

---
adambuttrick
02/11/2022, 04:17:24 | 02/11/2022, 04:17:24
comment_text: @mpfl Your insights are always appreciated here! Including here for additional context that we have precedents in ROR for similar organizations, such as the Australian National Imaging Facility (https://ror.org/01kdbsa35) and AuScope (https://ror.org/04s1m4564). See also the discussion on Microscopy Australia in issue #49.

---
adambuttrick
02/11/2022, 16:39:06 | 02/11/2022, 16:39:59
comment_text: Discussed this further with @mariagould: we are recommending inclusion in ROR, given the additional context provided by CSIRO and ARDC, as well as following the prior decision-making process for similar use cases, (e.g. #49). We will discuss this use case more generally in our next curator meeting and continue working with groups in Australia to make sure they have adequate representation. Thank you once again, @mpfl and @alslib, for your feedback and concern for these issues!

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:30:08 | 03/17/2022, 22:30:08
comment_text: Assigned ROR ID https://ror.org/02jfhsn35 in release v1.0.

How will a ROR ID for this organization be used? To identify affiliations for research publications, To identify affiliations for datasets, To acknowledge research funders, To acknowledge a research facility

comments:
arthurpsmith
12/15/2021, 19:40:46 | 12/15/2021, 19:40:46
comment_text: This is a new institute located at University of Strasburg - https://ror.org/00pg6eq24 - (also the website is under the unistra.fr domain, and the affiliations in the example provided list both the institute and U. Strasburg as affiliation). However, it is also a CNRS -funded institute. Given the way we've handled similar institutes at other French universities this probably should have its own ROR id, but it might be something we should wait a bit on, or defer since so far it doesn't seem to be independent of the university.

---
KellyStathis
02/08/2022, 19:56:35 | 02/08/2022, 19:56:35
comment_text: We may need to have a consistent approach to CNRS funded institutes, including UMRs. My understanding is that they not independent of universities, but they can be cross-institutional collaborations. They can also be time-limited since funding is renewable, not ongoing. Looking at the Advanced Search at https://annuaire.cnrs.fr/NavigationServlet there are over 1,400 with Country=France.

Does anyone on the curation advisory board have more context for how these are structured? I found https://www.cnrs.fr/fr/cnrsinfo/le-cnrs-simplifie-ses-structures-de-recherche but I am still fuzzy on the details.

Moving to "Needs discussion" :)

---
mariagould
02/10/2022, 23:50:50 | 02/10/2022, 23:51:46
comment_text: I agree with Kelly on taking a bigger-picture look in the future at all of the CNRS-related records. 

For the present case, it looks like the institute formed recently as a merger between the Institute of Earth Physics of Strasbourg and the Laboratory of Hydrology and Geochemistry of Strasbourg (see https://ites.unistra.fr/linstitut/historique-anciennes-umrs). The second entity has a ROR ID: https://ror.org/03y81da23. 

Given the number of publications already associated with the institute, and its unique position with having multiple parents (Univ of Strasbourg, CNRS, and ENGEES), and its position as a merged entity of the prior two organizations, I think it would make sense to create a new ROR ID for Institut Terre et Environnement de Strasbourg. 

I will file a separate issue for redirecting https://ror.org/03y81da23 to the new ROR ID when we have redirecting functionality in place, and another issue for analyzing and cleaning up CNRS records.

---
adambuttrick
03/17/2022, 22:29:47 | 03/17/2022, 22:29:47
comment_text: Assigned ROR ID https://ror.org/0530qwm02 in release v1.0.
